Please help us! "How much is Needed? 450,000 Kenya
shillings or 5,000 US dollars will directly support two primary school clubs in Nairobi (BuruBuru 1 Primary School and Ayany Primary School) with their running costs, and it will support the development of an online platform and a newspaper to connect all of the clubs across the country. "At Integrity Clubs in our schools, we learn about corruption, and how we can stop it. Through crafts, music ,art, essays, poetry, games and discussion, we share our experiences of corruption and learn that there is a different way of doing things. We learn how to resist corruption and how to build a better Kenya.This way, we can speak to and connect with other children who also care. We show other children that it is not hopeless, and that we are not alone!We hope you see why this is valuable for us and for the future of Kenya! Thank You! With Best Wishes, from the Primary School Children of BuruBuru1 and Ayany! "More about the Campaign from the people supporting us...
Hello, we're Transparency
International Kenya - a not-for-profit organization founded in 1999 in Kenya with the aim of developing a transparent and corruption free society through good governance and social justice initiatives.We're an autonomous member of the global anti-corruption movement. We provide a platform for sharing knowledge and experience, develop strategies to respond to regionally distinct patterns of corruption and
initiate advocacy campaigns at both the regional and sub-regional level.  Young people are the future of our country. In order to empower them to be positive change-makers, we helped to establish Integrity Clubs in schools across Kenya, to give children
in those schools a platform to engage on integrity and anti-corruption issues. 100% of the
contribution that will be received will be used to finance the activities of the
two Integrity clubs, supporting Kenyan Children to resist corruption. Such
activities include: education and communication materials designed for children, an online learning platform, a club delegation to parliament to present a
petition to parliament, and an art and essay fair, to mention but a few. The Children of Kenya are tired of corruption. Please donate to show them that you agree. By keeping open their integrity clubs, you can help them to say No to corruption and secure lasting change towards a better future for Kenya.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!Please help us share this campaign with your friends by using the social media share buttons in this page.Follow Transparency
International Kenya on Facebook
and Twitter

story:
Help Send Jack To School!

Hello! My name is Jack and I am an artist and yoga teacher living in Lexington, KY.

I've been teaching yoga for three years and practicing for eight. When I first started practicing yoga I was overweight, unhealthy, had drug and alcohol problems and was very depressed. As I practiced my body awareness grew, and with that an awareness of what was and wasn't healthy in my life. I was able to change my diet and quit drinking, doing drugs and smoking and so I lost weight and saw great improvements in my physical health. Excercising everyday through yoga improved my mood, relieved stress and gave me time to focus and taught me discipline. After several years of rehabilitating my unhealthy body and focusing my scattered mind through yoga I was able to start excercising in earnest: I biked, solo, from San Francisco to Yosemite (a 500 mile round trip); I started running and became an avid hiker; I started rock climbing and now train so that I can continue to enjoy this dynamic sport; I have recently started working with bodyweight excercises and kettlebells and focusing on building strength; I continue to experiment with flexibility and mobility.


What all of this taught me is that MOVEMENT is the key to a happy and healthy life. Human beings evolved to understand and communicate with our world through movement, and without it we suffer terribly.

Because I have a thirst to understand as well as to do, and I am passionate about teaching and sharing my knowlege I pushed myself as a yoga teacher to learn as much as I could about the human body and how it can move efficiently and healthily. At last I found a program at an amazing school that approached the body, excercise, health and training in a holistic manner that was in line with my philosophies and that I knew would push me with its rigorous scientifically-based academic program and highly qualified teaching staff. That school is the Lexington Healing Arts Academy where I will be enrolling in a 1 year/840 hour Personal Fitness Trainer program this Spring that will culminate with the National Academy of Sports Medicine exam to become a Certified Personal Trainer.

Wellness has become a burning passion for me because of my personal journey and the amazing opportunities I have had to witness my students make their own transformations. As I said earlier a healthy and happy life is dependant upon healthy movement. Becoming a Certified Personal Trainer will expand my knowlege to a huge degree and better enable me to help people move in a healthy and efficient way.It was not until I began to make myself healthy that I felt my life had meaning, and that meaning has translated for me as a feeling of being called to inspire others to health. I sincerely hope to be of greater service by taking this opportunity to learn and grow as a teacher and trainer.

 

Why am I asking for $6500?

I have taken out federal loans to pay for the majority of my tuition ($8867.00 of $12500.00), but I still owe $3633.00 to the school before the first day of classes on April 17th.  Additionally because my class schedule will be 9am to 1pm Monday through Friday, and I am told to expect 8-12 hours of homework a week, I will only be able to work part-time so that I can dedicate adequate time to my studies. Through teaching part time I will be able to cover rent, utilities, gas, car insurance, taxes and food. However there will be nothing left over if I have medical costs, am sick or need extra time to study and need to teach slightly less or have an unforseen financial need. As a student in the PFT program I am expected to dress appropriately and professionally (in other words, I need to be in workout clothes so that I can participate in excercises that we are learning and not the same pair of gross sweat pants that I workout at the climbing gym in). I believe $6500 will be sufficient to cover these financial needs.

Your contributions will go to tuition, living expenses while I am in school and materials for school. 

 

But what do you get?

First of all you get another CERTIFIED and EDUCATED Personal Trainer in the world. Why does that matter? Because an uncertified and uneducated trainer is unsafe and ineffective. And if you live in the Lexington, KY area you're going to get access to one of the best, hardest working, most dedicated trainers interested in your whole health: ME!


You also get the satisfaction of helping someone to realize their goals to educate themselves, be of service to others in a meaningful way and embark on a sustainable and rewarding career.

But I've got some good stuff for you personally too!

Donate $25 and you'll get an original piece of thank-you art (remember what I said at the top? I'm a yoga teacher AND an artist!). You'll also get my undying grattitude and if you're local, a big muscle-y hug next time i see you (hug offer not valid May through September, you know what it's like in Central Kentucky then!)

Donate $50 and I've got buckets of grattitude for you, a humidity-free hug and I'll make you an original piece of art BY REQUEST (you pick it, i'll draw it in magical jack style!)

Donate $100 and you will be showered in grattitude, hugged until your eyes pop out of your skull, a piece of art by request and I will make you your own personal best workout mix CD IN THE WORLD!

Donate $500 and you are in for such a treat! You'll be wallowing in grattitude, i'll be hugging you like winnie-the-pooh snuggling that honey pot, you'll be admiring your very own personally requested art (suitable for framing), rocking out to an amazeballs workout mix and then WE WILL WORKOUT because i'll give you a free training session once i've graduated and passed my certification exam!!!

HEY BIG SPENDER! Donate $1000 and receive all the same perks as the $500 donation with this one big important addition: I MAKE DINNER. Are you thinking beans-n-franks? Mac-n-cheese? NO! We are talking Jack-dinner, that translates in English into things like: steak, bacon-wrapped sausages, grilled tuna steaks, massaged kale salads, roasted brussel sprouts, hand-cut sweet potatoe fries, crispy super-green fresh salads, mushroom rice, summer goat cheese quinoa salad, butternut squash and farro, baked apples, frozen banana cocoa "ice cream," wheat-free PB&J cookies. I will make a special menu just for you and we will spend some quality time at the gnome home eating these tasty treats. And yes, I can do vegetarian or vegan, too!

The "I love you Jack, but I'm broke!" Gift:  Spread the word, friend! Share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, through email, word of mouth or any other way you can think of! Indiegogo has lots of share tools you can use!

All of my successes in life have been largely depend upon the generosity of an amazing family and community of friends and supporters. So much of that generosity and support has been non-monetary, and that does not make it one iota less important or loving. I understand if you can't swing it, I appreciate any support you can give in any form. And I thank you for reading all this and for your positive thoughts and love!


HEALTHY BODY, HAPPY LIFE...FOR EVERYBODY!

story:
Who We are...

Our names are Leah and Olivia. We are two high school seniors at The Big Picture School in South Burlington, Vermont.  For our senior thesis project we want to travel to Ghana, West Africa and provide a creative outlet and positive curriculum for the students of a rural secondary school.

 

The Trip

We will be travelling to Hatsukope (Hatch-oo-cope-uh), a very small village in the Eastern Volta region of Ghana, West Africa. 

Our hope for this trip is to create an equal learning experience for both of us, and the students.  One of our goals, along with preparing a stimulating curriculum, is to work together with the students and kids of the community to illustrate a mural.  The purpose of this mural is to give the students an attainable goal to  accomplish through their own ideas, cooperation, and imagination.  We will also be providing this opportunity for students at our high school in South Burlingon, Vermont.  Through this project, we will introduce a cultural connection of ideas between both communities. 

 

Why Help Hatsukope?

The average young person living in the Eastern Volta Region of Ghana has very few creative opportunities and outlets available. As seventeen-year-old high schoolers, Leah and I do not intend to “teach” these students because in reality, we have as much to learn from them, as they do from us.  Our goal is to provide a positive, joy-filled, and productive experience for our fellow young people of the world. Instead of cutting into the student’s school time, our curriculum will be taking place as an after school program, making sure that the students have time to study and prepare for exams. However, we will be available at the school throughout our month stay for tutoring and simple student assistance.

In 9th grade, Olivia attended a local school in Ghana for a three month term, located within a quarter mile of Hatsukope Secondary School.  With the experience of attending a Ghanaian secondary school in hand, Olivia has both knowledge about what is needed in the area, as well as awareness of how to go about it properly. This preparation will ensure that no time, money or effort is wasted. With our goal to create a positive learning environment full of cultural exploration and artistic expression, your support will go directly towards smiles, laughs, and learning.  Thank you!

 

How you can help!

In order to fulfill this goal we need art supplies and adequate travel accommodations.  Your support will help us acquire these materials and necessities.

If you can’t contribute, don’t worry! Please, tell a friend, family member, or even stranger on the street. Anything helps! 

Thank you so much for your time and support.

Leah and Olivia

story:
In the name of God; The most Gracious, The most Merciful

 

What are we proposing you may ask? A chance for we as a community to make a change, to come together as one and react and respond to our brothers and sisters in need. To inspire change and possibly cause a ripple effect to something great. Our goal is for Palestine.

 

Muslims Without Borders has launched projects in Palestine that have opened up wells and provided students in the Al-Rowward School in the Aida Refugee Camp in the West Bank with school supplies. Its that time again, we need funds for more projects like these to thrive, this time not just supplies but laptops for students to take a better advantage of the learning process.

 

NOW WHAT?

 

It’s time to take a stand and to donate. Take a pledge now to make a ONE-TIME donation of $20*. That’s not it, recruit 10 of your closest friends to make the same ONE-TIME donation.

 

Our Goal is $5000, and we need the community’s help

 

Education is key for children to succeed and have an opportunity wherever they may be. We owe it to ourselves and to them. Join us inshaAllah.

 

This will start today November 25th, 2012- December 9th, 2012. Donations are accepted online here.

 

Or in person contact: ralhalali@mwbrelief.org (MWB-GMU President)

                               dnour@masonlive.gmu.edu (MWB-GMU Vice President)

                               widlibi@gmu.edu (GMU-MWB Treasurer)

                               yfaisal@masonlive.gmu.edu (GMU-MWB Events Coordinator)

                               yhasanza@masonlive.gmu.edu (GMU-MWB Secretary)

story:
Hello. My name is Luke Ottewell-Girling, I'm 17 years old and I suffer from a rare condition: acute love for science,


I was born in April of 1998 in Barcelona, Spain, and I currently still live on the outskirts of the city, with my parents and my older sister. I attend IES Can Puig, a state-run secondary education center (High School), where I'm studying the scientific baccalaureate. This means I study, on top of the obligatory subjects (Spanish, Catalan and English, Philosophy, P.E, and Modern Sciences), Biology, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics. Although I enjoy most aspects of my student life, I'm never happier in school than when I'm in one of my science lessons.

Last year I heard about an event held in London every year which brings together the next generation of young scientists aged between 17-21, and immerses them in the world of academia. The participants of this project are able to attend numerous science lectures held in the world-renowned Imperial College facilities, lectured by pioneering academics and surrounded by young adults with the same interests as themselves.  Not only would this forum teach me, it would serve as an incredibly solid foundation from which to build and pursue a career in science.

I have from a very young age wanted to be involved in the world of science, and this forum would, on top of everything else, count as a very good experience on my application to universities. Although university is still a year away, I believe initiative is a hugely valuable asset.

I'm appealing for a sum of £1500 which covers the cost of the forum. These expenses range from accommodation to food, lectures and transport. Any donation is greatly appreciated and will be met with one of the great Perks up for offer. I promise to give back to every donor a token of gratitude, big or small. To check out more about these rewards please read on.

PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL DONATIONS WILL BE SENT TO MY MOTHER'S PAY PAL ACCOUNT AS I AM UNDER AGE AND THEREFORE CANNOT HAVE MY OWN ACCOUNT.

If the objective is not met, the money will still go towards the forum, and I'll  have to resort to some other alternative to get the rest of the quota. 

It's quite hard to state exactly how much this project means to me; it's a key to open so many doors in the future, and my first step towards reaching my extremely high aspirations of being a world renowned surgeon. I am currently working on a bio-physical energy alternative with the hope of opening the mind of some creators and using the incredibly effective human body as the most effective machine known to man.  Attending LIYSF would give me the opportunity to meet some of the pioneering minds in my field of study and enable me to start putting my work in to practice. 

If you cannot contribute to my project, please just spread the word and share it with your friends and loved ones. I'm incredibly motivated and dedicated to this project, and prepared to give 110% to reach my objectives. And, lastly, thank you for visiting my project and I hope to be sending you my Perks very soon!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hola, me llamo Luke y sufro de una condición muy peculiar: amor  inestimable hacia la ciencia.


Nací el 7 de Abril del 1998 en Barcelona, I actualmente sigo viviendo en las afueras de la ciudad, con mis padres y mi Hermana. Voy al IES Can Puig, un instituto público en el que curso la modalidad científica del bachillerato. Disfruto mucho de mi vida estudiantil, pero no hay nada que prefiera a estar en una clase de ciencias.

El año pasado descubrí un campus de verano anual que pretende ajuntar a la nueva generación de científicos de entre 17-21 años e insertarlos en un ambiente científico rodeado de jóvenes como ellos. Se lleva a cabo en la prestigiosa Universidad Imperial College London, y los participantes del campus tienen la oportunidad de asistir a conferencias dadas por científicos pioneros y estar inmersos en un ambiente académico. Este fórum, además de enseñarme muchas cosas, me serviría mucho para cuando vaya a la Universidad en Inglaterra, donde este campus es valorado muy positivamente en las entrevistas de acceso. Desde muy joven me he interesado en la ciencia, y aunque aún me queda un año y medio para ir a la Universidad, considero que la iniciativa es un valor muy importante hoy en día.

Me dirijo a ustedes hoy para intentar recaudar £1500, el precio del fórum. Este precio, además de cubrir los gastos de las múltiples conferencias, incluye alojamiento en Imperial College, comida y transporte por Londres. Cualquier donación será recibida muy gratamente, y recibiréis pequeños detalles llamados “Perks” al donar. Solo hace faltado donar y escoger un Perk y recibiréis un pequeño detalle de mi gratitud. Ver la parte de Perks para más detalles sobre los detalles que podéis escoger.

TODAS LAS DONACIONES IRÁN AL PAYPAL DE MI MADRE, DADO A QUE SOY MENOR DE EDAD Y NO PUEDO TENER UNA CUENTA PROPIA.

Es complicado explicar cuánto me gustaría asistir a este fórum: además de ser una enorme experiencia, me abriría una cantidad enorme de puertas en el futuro próximo. Al final del fórum podré presentar un proyecto, y actualmente estoy trabajando por cultivos de células madre con el afán de descubrir nuevas posibilidad con la máquina más eficaz del mundo: el cuerpo humano.

Si no podéis donar, pido que por favor compartáis mi proyecto con amigos y familiares, y agradeciéndoles muchísimo  por leer mi página, espero poder enviaros mis Perks muy pronto!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hola, em dic Luke i pateixo d’una malaltia molt estranya: amor incondicional a la ciència.

Vaig néixer el 7 d’abril del 1998 a Barcelona, i segueixo vivint als afores de la ciutat amb els meus pares i la meva germana. Vaig a l’IES Can Puig, un institut públic a Sant Pere de Ribes, on estudio el batxillerat científic. Tot i que gaudeixo molt a l’institut, sóc més feliç que mai quan estic a una classe de ciències.

L’any passat vaig sentir parlar d’un fòrum que té lloc cada any a Londres i que pretén ajuntar una nova generació de científics prometedors d’entre 17 i 21 anys, i els exposa al món acadèmic. Els participants tenen l’oportunitat d’assistir a nombroses conferències de científics pioners arreu del món a les instal·lacions de la prestigiosa universitat Imperial College London. M’encantaria poder assistir-hi a aquest fòrum. Podré conèixer a molts joves com jo, i a l’hora d’accedir a les universitats angleses, valoren molt aquest campus. Tot i que encara em queda temps per apuntar-me, considero que és molt important planificar-se bé, i la iniciativa és un valor vital avui en dia.

M’adreço a vostès avui per intentar recaptar £1500, el preu del fòrum. Aquest preu, a més d’incloure el cost de les conferències, també inclou allotjament a l’Imperial College, menjar i transport per la capital britànica. Tota contribució serà rebuda molt gratament, i us enviaré petits gestos de la meva gratitud anomenats “Perks”. Miri la secció de perks per saber més.

TINGUI EN COMPTE QUE TOTA DONACIÓ ANIRÀ AL PAY PAL DE LA MEVA MARE, JA QUE AL SER MENOR D’EDAT NO PUC TENIR-NE UN PROPI PER MI MATEIX.

És difícil d’explicar lo molt que m’agradaria anar a aquest fòrum. És una clau que m’obrirà moltíssimes portes al meu futur molt pròxim, i em servirà com un primer pas per assolir el meu somni de ser un cirurgià. Actualment estic treballant amb cèl·lules mare, i intentant treure-li el màxim de profit a la màquina més eficaç del món: el cos humà.

Si no podeu contribuir, us demano si us plau que compartiu el meu projecte amb amics i familiars, i agraint-vos molt per llegir la meva pàgina, espero poder enviar-vos els meus Perks molt aviat!
story_txt:
Hello. My name is Luke Ottewell-Girling, I'm 17 years old and I suffer from a rare condition: acute love for science, 

I was born in April of 1998 in Barcelona, Spain, and I currently still live on the outskirts of the city, with my parents and my older sister. I attend IES Can Puig, a state-run secondary education center (High School), where I'm studying the scientific baccalaureate. This means I study, on top of the obligatory subjects (Spanish, Catalan and English, Philosophy, P.E, and Modern Sciences), Biology, Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics. Although I enjoy most aspects of my student life, I'm never happier in school than when I'm in one of my science lessons. 
Last year I heard about an event held in London every year which brings together the next generation of young scientists aged between 17-21, and immerses them in the world of academia. The participants of this project are able to attend numerous science lectures held in the world-renowned Imperial College facilities, lectured by pioneering academics and surrounded by young adults with the same interests as themselves.  Not only would this forum teach me, it would serve as an incredibly solid foundation from which to build and pursue a career in science. 
I have from a very young age wanted to be involved in the world of science, and this forum would, on top of everything else, count as a very good experience on my application to universities. Although university is still a year away, I believe initiative is a hugely valuable asset. 
I'm appealing for a sum of £1500 which covers the cost of the forum. These expenses range from accommodation to food, lectures and transport. Any donation is greatly appreciated and will be met with one of the great Perks up for offer. I promise to give back to every donor  a token of gratitude, big or small. To check out more about these rewards please read on. 
PLEASE NOTE THAT ALL DONATIONS WILL BE SENT TO MY MOTHER'S PAY PAL ACCOUNT AS I AM UNDER AGE AND THEREFORE CANNOT HAVE MY OWN ACCOUNT.
If the objective is not met, the money will still go towards the forum, and I'll  have to resort to some other alternative to get the rest of the quota. 
It's quite hard to state exactly how much this project means to me; it's a key to open so many doors in the future, and my first step towards reaching my extremely high aspirations of being a world renowned surgeon. I am currently working on a bio-physical energy alternative with the hope of opening the mind of some creators and using the incredibly effective human body as the most effective machine known to man.  Attending LIYSF would give me the opportunity to meet some of the pioneering minds in my field of study and enable me to start putting my work in to practice. 
If you cannot contribute to my project, please just spread the word and share it with your friends and loved ones. I'm incredibly motivated and dedicated to this project, and prepared to give 110% to reach my objectives. And, lastly, thank you for visiting my project and I hope to be sending you my Perks very soon!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hola, me llamo Luke y sufro de una condición muy
peculiar: amor  inestimable hacia la
ciencia. 


Nací el 7 de Abril del 1998 en Barcelona, I
actualmente sigo viviendo en las afueras de la ciudad, con mis padres y mi Hermana.
Voy al IES Can Puig, un instituto público en el que curso la modalidad
científica del bachillerato. Disfruto mucho de mi vida estudiantil, pero no hay
nada que prefiera a estar en una clase de ciencias. 
El año pasado descubrí un campus de verano anual que
pretende ajuntar a la nueva generación de científicos de entre 17-21 años e
insertarlos en un ambiente científico rodeado de jóvenes como ellos. Se lleva a
cabo en la prestigiosa Universidad Imperial College London, y los participantes
del campus tienen la oportunidad de asistir a conferencias dadas por
científicos pioneros y estar inmersos en un ambiente académico. Este fórum,
además de enseñarme muchas cosas, me serviría mucho para cuando vaya a la Universidad
en Inglaterra, donde este campus es valorado muy positivamente en las
entrevistas de acceso. Desde muy joven me he interesado en la ciencia, y aunque
aún me queda un año y medio para ir a la Universidad, considero que la
iniciativa es un valor muy importante hoy en día.
Me dirijo a ustedes hoy para intentar recaudar £1500,
el precio del fórum. Este precio, además de cubrir los gastos de las múltiples
conferencias, incluye alojamiento en Imperial College, comida y transporte por
Londres. Cualquier donación será recibida muy gratamente, y recibiréis pequeños
detalles llamados “Perks” al donar. Solo hace faltado donar y escoger un Perk y
recibiréis un pequeño detalle de mi gratitud. Ver la parte de Perks para más
detalles sobre los detalles que podéis escoger.
TODAS LAS DONACIONES IRÁN AL PAYPAL DE MI MADRE, DADO A QUE SOY MENOR DE EDAD Y NO PUEDO TENER UNA CUENTA PROPIA.
Es complicado explicar cuánto me gustaría asistir
a este fórum: además de ser una enorme experiencia, me abriría una cantidad
enorme de puertas en el futuro próximo. Al final del fórum podré presentar un
proyecto, y actualmente estoy trabajando por cultivos de células madre con el
afán de descubrir nuevas posibilidad con la máquina más eficaz del mundo: el
cuerpo humano. 
Si no podéis donar, pido que por favor compartáis
mi proyecto con amigos y familiares, y agradeciéndoles muchísimo  por leer mi página, espero poder enviaros mis
Perks muy pronto!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 
  

Hola, em dic Luke
i pateixo d’una malaltia molt estranya: amor incondicional a la ciència. 
Vaig néixer el 7 d’abril del 1998 a Barcelona,
i segueixo vivint als afores de la ciutat amb els meus pares i la meva germana.
Vaig a l’IES
Can Puig, un institut públic a Sant Pere de Ribes, on estudio el batxillerat
científic. Tot i que gaudeixo molt a l’institut, sóc més feliç que mai quan
estic a una classe de ciències.
L’any
passat vaig sentir parlar d’un fòrum que té lloc cada any a Londres i que
pretén ajuntar una nova generació de científics prometedors d’entre 17 i 21
anys, i els exposa al món acadèmic. Els participants tenen l’oportunitat
d’assistir a nombroses conferències de científics pioners arreu del món a les
instal·lacions de la prestigiosa universitat Imperial College
London. M’encantaria poder assistir-hi a aquest fòrum. Podré conèixer a molts
joves com jo, i a l’hora d’accedir a les universitats angleses, valoren molt
aquest campus. Tot i que encara em queda temps per apuntar-me, considero que és
molt important planificar-se bé, i la iniciativa és un valor vital avui en dia.

M’adreço a vostès avui per intentar recaptar £1500,
el preu del fòrum. Aquest preu, a més d’incloure el cost de les conferències,
també inclou allotjament a l’Imperial College,
menjar i transport per la capital britànica. Tota contribució serà rebuda molt
gratament, i us enviaré petits gestos de la meva gratitud anomenats “Perks”.
Miri la secció de perks
per saber més. 
TINGUI EN COMPTE QUE TOTA DONACIÓ ANIRÀ AL PAY
PAL DE LA MEVA MARE, JA QUE AL SER MENOR D’EDAT NO PUC TENIR-NE
UN PROPI PER MI MATEIX.
És
difícil d’explicar lo
molt que m’agradaria anar a aquest fòrum. És una clau que m’obrirà moltíssimes
portes al meu futur molt pròxim, i em servirà com un primer pas per assolir el
meu somni de ser un cirurgià. Actualment estic treballant amb cèl·lules mare, i
intentant treure-li
el màxim de profit a la màquina més eficaç del món: el cos humà. 
Si no podeu contribuir, us demano si us plau
que compartiu el meu projecte amb amics i familiars, i agraint-vos molt per
llegir la meva pàgina, espero poder enviar-vos els meus Perks
molt aviat!

story:
The Makoto Dojo, School of Aikido, Inc. is seeking support for our Strong Kids, Safe Kids initiative.  This program provides training in physical and mental techniques of self defense, while promoting greater awareness of the potential for incidents of violence and their warning signs to children in the Ventura County/Southern California Community.  This new program will have an immediate positive impact on the safety and lives of children of our community by providing them with an effective means to defend themselves in a violent encounter.  In order to accomplish this goal, our organization has created a scholarship program that will make the training available to every child of the community regardless of their financial situation.  The program faces several challenges including the inability of individuals to pay for services, the need for additional instructors, additional equipment, existing equipment/facility maintenance and repair as well as additional class scheduling.  The program’s immediate impact and success is dependant upon these challenges being overcome.

We know that many of you simply cannot contribute money, but that does not mean you still cannot help.  We would appreciate it if you use the Indiegogo Share Tools and help us get the word out about our programs and the need for raising funds.  When is it going to be enough for you to make some noise about what kids these days have to deal with in the way of violence?  Now is the time to take action and help us to help more children!!

Incidents of violence and violent crimes are an increasingly undeniable problem in our society today.  According to a publication released by the Ventura Police Department “In 2011, our city had a 24% increase in violent crime…  There has also been a highly visible increase in criminal and anti-social behavior in some of the most visible public areas of our community.” Just recently in Aurora, Colorado 72 people were shot by a person just because he was angry; 12 of these people died.

Our organization’s mission is to provide vitally important physical and mental survival skills to students while strengthening their character through an emphasis on the foundation building blocks of kindness, compassion, honesty and integrity. Our Chief Instructor Larry Reynosa has more than 38 years of training and experience as a student and instructor in the martial art of Aikido.  He is one of the highest ranking instructors in the world and has provided training for law enforcement agencies, military agencies, private security agencies, colleges and hospitals throughout the world.

Since it’s founding, Makoto Dojo School of Aikido, Inc. has provided training specifically designed to serve children through self-defense and assault prevention training.  Through the Strong Kids, Safe Kids program, our organization will also seek to collaborate with local organizations and agencies involved with combating violence, bullying and domestic abuse. Makoto Dojo School of Aikido, Inc. currently serves approximately 400 students including men, women and children of the Ventura County Community and is an approved off-campus facility for students of Foothill Technology High School to earn P.E. credits.

The Makoto Dojo, School of Aikido, Inc. has been in operation in Ventura, California for over 30 years and was incorporated as a 501(c)(3) Charitable Non-profit organization January 18, 2008.  The organization is funded by student membership fees, donations, service activities, grants and fund raising.  Since its inception, the organization has provided self-defense training and programs based on the martial art of Aikido to thousands of students around the world.  Aikido is a non-competitive, Japanese martial art that promotes peaceful reconciliation through the practice of non-resistive technique, which allows anyone the possibility of defending themselves effectively, regardless of size or strength. 

Other programs provided by our organization include Self-Defense and Assault Prevention through Ventura College, Women’s Self Defense Classes and Workshops, Hospital Staff and Security Workshops and Children’s Self-Defense Workshops. Additionally, the school has provided cross-generation classes where children have been able to train with adults to learn the difference in power and strength that a real child predator may have. 

With physical training and emphasis on accountability and responsibility the organization has had a significant positive impact through its students for decades.  Students of Makoto Dojo include law enforcement officers, military personnel, attorneys, state and county government employees, professionals, home makers and children, all of whom incorporate the organizations building blocks into their daily lives and professions.  Countless students have returned to the organization with accounts of experiences in which the training (physical and mental) has allowed them to survive or avoid dangerous situations and attacks.

As a result of the recent and continued decline of the state and national economy, many individuals and families are having to decrease spending to get by and are often unable to participate in activities designed to increase personal safety.  While many local programs offer services for victims of bullying and violence, there is a lack of services to empower children with effective, viable physical skills to defend themselves from a violent attack.  Makoto Dojo School of Aikido, Inc. seeks to fill this need through the “Strong Kids, Safe Kids” scholarship program. 

In closing, The Makoto Dojo, School of Aikido, Inc. and its instructors have taken on a mission to have a positive impact on our community and the world by addressing the problem of violence in our society.  The Strong Kids, Safe Kids program provides a means to achieve this goal and will allow us the ability to provide skills and instruction to those who need it most and who, in many cases, cannot afford to pursue such programs.  According to law enforcement agencies, researchers and experts, incidents of violence in our society are an increasing problem and will not be impacted without positive action. 

Thank you for your time and consideration of this program and our organization. 

Sincerely,

Larry Reynosa Chief Instructor/CEO, Makoto Dojo, School of Aikido, Inc.

story:
Robotics In Medicine: Future Healthcare Professionals

The 2013 Scholarobotics Academy offers an accelerated educational opportunity for high school students interested in medicine to earn college credit (i.e. Medical Terminology, Pathophysiology), be introduced to basic dissections and suturing skills required in surgical procedures, and to conduct STEM Research in medicine and robotics. This unique program provides scholars with face-to-face lectures along with hybrid-online assignments, hands-on learning using Anatomy In Clay models, and animal dissections. Scholarobotic scholars also were able to conduct STEM Research at the medical facility’s operating room using a medical robotic system, the “da Vinci robot arm.”

This special program will allow the 15 scholars to present at the 2013 Robotic Assisted Microsurgical & Endoscopy Society Symposium in Strasbourg, France.  

2013 Rock n’ Tour to France

We Need Your Support!

We need $23,000 to send our scholars to Strasbourg, France for a once in a lifetime opportunity!  Scholars will have a unique opportunity to present their Scholarobotics Academy Research projects at an International professional conference, the 2013 Robotic Assisted Microsurgical & Endoscopy Society (RAMSES) Symposium, November 8 & 9 at IRCAD/EITS Laparoscopic Center at Strasbourg University Hospital.  These students will have the opportunity to network with others who hold medical degrees and higher education degrees.  We need your support to send ALL scholars to France.  As an incentive we will provide you with a Rock n’ Tour gift from France.

The funds collected will be used to send students to the 2013 RAMSES Conference in France this November.  If the entire goal is not reached then some students will be required to pay their own individual expenses.  If the goal is exceeded a fund will be established with the Polk State College Foundation to fund future Scholarbotics Study Abroad opportunities.

The Academy Academic team members are all recognized professionals


Professor Suzanne Ramjattan Halverson

  • Earned a doctorate in Health Science in 2009
  • Earned a mater’s degree in science education in 2005
  • A professor for five years teaching anatomy and physiology, science, technology, engineering, and math courses at Polk State College
  • Names Florida 2012 SME Teacher of the year by the Society of Mining, Metallurgy, and Exploration
  • Earned the George Jenkins Endowed Faculty Chair in 2012
  • Name Teacher of the Year in 2010 and 2012

In 2010-2011, Halverson initiated the STEM Research Enhancement Program to facilitate student success in STEM disciplines by providing students with targeted academic advising, academic support, and a rigorous STEM Research Course. As part of the STEM Research course, students have competed in science and engineering fairs and participated in numerous professional conferences Robotic Assisted Microsurgery Endoscopy Symposium (RAMES) allowing students to get to know and network with STEM practitioners and raise their awareness of STEM related careers.

          

Dr. Sijo Parekattil 

  • Director of the Robotics Surgery Department at Winter Haven Hospital
  • Assistant Professor at the University of Florida’s Department of Urology
  • Adjunct professor for UF’s Bioengineering Department
  • Received a BS in Electrical Engineering from the University of Michigan
  • Graduated from New York Medical College in 1998
  • Received numerous awards, including two Annual Innovator Awards from the Cleveland Clinic Foundation
  • Published several articles in the field of robotic microsurgery
  • Co-editor of an upcoming textbook on Male Infertility and a surgical textbook on Robotic Microsurgery

Dr. Parekattil has performed some pioneering work in the arena of robotic microsurgery and has now performed over 700 such procedures. He has developed a multi-disciplinary program dedicated to the treatment of male infertility and groin/testicular pain. He is also a Visiting Professor at the University of Zambia, Lusaka, Africa and is involved in a multi-institutional program to deliver medical equipment, training and supplies to the Urology Department at the University Teaching Hospital in Lusaka.


Dr. Ahmet Gudeloglu 

  • Graduated from Ondokuz Mayis University School of Medicine in Samsun Turkey
  • Earned Urology degree at Hacettepe University in Ankara, Turkey
  • Recognized European Board of Urology
  • Published several articles in the field of robotic microsurgery
  • Currently a Research Fellow in Robotic Microsurgery and Cochrane Prostatic Diseases and Urologic Cancers Group at University of Florida

Dr. Halverson had a significant role in developing the Scholarbotics Academy, a proven partnership between Polk State College and the Center for Urology at Winter Haven Hospital. Drs. Parekattil and Gudeloglu are overseeing the four Scholarobotics Academy Research Projects:  1) Robotic Surgical Assistant, 2) Robotic Surgical Irrigation Assistant, 3) Robotic Microsurgical Suturing-Dual E-Z Robot Arms, and 4) Dynamic Teleconference System.  The four research projects have the potential to be published in scholarly journals. 

Why Scholarobotics Academy?

  • Increase scholars to prepare for a medical career                                           
  • Spark interest in medical research focusing robotics 
  • Develop professional experiences

The Scholarobotics Academy adds a dimension to learning that is so unique because high school aged students are not just book learning, but participating in a research project that examines a real world issue and its possible solution.  Students are learning how to conduct medical research and to present the material to healthcare professionals in a professional manner. Additionally, academy participants are immersed in medical terminology, medicine’s universal language and learn the basics of suturing. 

Overview

The 2012 Academy participants earn college credit in Medical Terminology. Scholars learned basic suturing skills and honed their suturing utilizing the daVinci arm OR robot.  The inaugural scholars presented the results of their individual research projects at the 2012 RAMSES conference in Tampa, Florida.  The healthcare professionals very well received the student presentations in attendance.

Medical Terminology

  • Universal Language of Medicine
  • Specimen Dissection
  • Basic suturing skills

STEM Research Experience

  • Used the da Vinci surgical robotic system
  • Prepared scientific posters
  • Presented at the 2012 RAMSES Conference in Tampa

Pathophysiology 

  • Introduction to diseases and disorders of the human body
  • Specific Specimen Dissection

Robotic Research Experience

  • 4 Research Project Teams

STEM Research Experience

  • Opportunity to present at the 2013 RAMSES Conference in France
  • Opportunities for students attending the Scholarobotics Academy and traveling to Strasbourg, France.
  • Be part of a published research study
  • Conduct research with Higher Ed Protocols

  • Be immersed with Innovation & Cutting Edge Robotics such as EZ-Robot Kits (http://www.ez-robot.com/) and Double Robotics (http://www.doublerobotics.com/) 

  • Learn how to present scholarly material

You Can Make a Difference in a Scholars Academic Future!

Let’s make a DIFFERENCE support this amazing once in a lifetime opportunity for a young scholar to present his or her research project in France, who knows one of these scholars might be YOUR FUTURE HEALTHCARE PROVIDER or BIOENGINEER.

Please assist us with sharing this unique opportunity with others through Indiegogo!  

Thank you for your support!

Center for Urology at Winter Haven Hospital. Drs. Parekattil and Gudeloglu
are overseeing the four Scholarobotics Academy Research Projects:  1)
Robotic Surgical Assistant, 2) Robotic Surgical Irrigation Assistant, 3)
Robotic Microsurgical Suturing-Dual E-Z Robot Arms, and 4) Dynamic
Teleconference System.  The four research projects have the potential to
be published in scholarly journals. 


Why Scholarobotics Academy?


Increase
scholars to prepare for a medical career                                           
Spark interest in
medical research focusing robotics 
Develop
professional experiences





The Scholarobotics Academy adds a dimension to learning that
is so unique because high school aged students are not just book learning, but
participating in a research project that examines a real world issue and its
possible solution.  Students are learning
how to conduct medical research and to present the material to healthcare
professionals in a professional manner. Additionally, academy participants are
immersed in medical terminology, medicine’s universal language and learn the
basics of suturing. 
Overview


The 2012 Academy participants
earn college credit in Medical Terminology. Scholars learned basic suturing
skills and honed their suturing utilizing the daVinci arm OR robot.  The
inaugural scholars presented the results of their individual research projects
at the 2012 RAMSES conference in Tampa, Florida.  The healthcare
professionals very well received the student presentations in attendance.

Medical
Terminology



Universal
Language of Medicine


Specimen
Dissection


Basic
suturing skills



STEM
Research Experience


Used the 
da Vinci surgical robotic system
Prepared scientific
posters
Presented at the 2012 RAMSES Conference in Tampa


Pathophysiology 



Introduction to diseases and
disorders of the human body

Specific Specimen Dissection

Robotic Research
Experience

4 Research Project Teams

STEM Research
Experience


Opportunity to present at the 2013
RAMSES Conference in France


Opportunities
for students attending the Scholarobotics Academy and traveling to 
Strasbourg,
France.


Be part of
a published research study


Conduct
research with Higher Ed Protocols


Be
immersed with Innovation & Cutting Edge Robotics such as EZ-Robot Kits (http://www.ez-robot.com/) and Double Robotics (http://www.doublerobotics.com/) 

Learn how
to present scholarly material


You Can Make a Difference in a Scholars Academic Future!
Let’s make a DIFFERENCE support this
amazing once in a lifetime opportunity for a young scholar to present his or
her research project in France, who knows one of these scholars might be YOUR
FUTURE HEALTHCARE PROVIDER or BIOENGINEER.
Please assist us with sharing this unique
opportunity with others through Indiegogo!  Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello, my name is Soraya Schilte, I am 22 years old and I live in the Netherlands. If I'm allowed to say so about myself, I am a smart and very driven person. I have always wanted to go to university but because of a troubled childhood, sometimes I wasn't able to go to school, and when I did go to school I was so preoccupied with the situation at home that I wasn't able to study well. 

This resulted in me dropping from the best "high school" in town, down to the worst. When I was about to finally get a diploma, I got Pfeiffer's disease. This is basically a temporary illness that makes you very tired, that only time can cure. Because of this I was forced to quit school and I never graduated. 

After recovering from Pfeiffer's disease, I picked up the pieces once again and decided to got back to school. From day one I was amongst the best of the students and I am currently in my last year.

Recently I have discovered a deep passion for Korea. A passion so deep that I want to devote all my time to studying this subject. Even though I don't meet the requirements I applied and after 8 weeks of stress I finally received the result today. I will be allowed into the program if I pass 3 exams and 2 courses.

When I read this I was really happy, until I found out what it costs to take those tests. As soon as I am enrolled in uni, all my study costs will be paid for by the government, but I have to pay for my exams myself. My mother's relationship with alcohol and drugs, has driven not only her, but also myself into debt. Because of that I can not bring up the money to pay for these exams.

I would hate to have to say goodbye to my dream, because of my troubled childhood and the financial troubles that resulted into. All the money raised will go into the cost of the courses. Even if I raise only part of my goal, I would be able to take whichever exams that would allow me to take and save up for the rest. Please help me fulfill my dream!

Out of the box training that gets participants thinking in terms of possibility and able to see boundaries that impede achieving big goals.

The training breaks down limiting beliefs, gets participants comfortable being uncomfortable, in general it puts a magnifying glass on the participants life all in the name of getting the person executing on a high level.  

Contribute as little ($1) or as much as you would like.  Thanks in advance for helping me out!

story:
Support Diana's election leaflet

Diana Toynbee is the Green Party candidate for Hereford and South Herefordshire. She wants to offer a real alternative locally to the politics-as-usual parties. To do this, she wants to be able to fund a leaflet to be delivered to every home in the constituency, at a cost of  £800. In the video Diana explains why she is standing and asks viewers for contributions towards this amount.

What We Need

We can get an A5 leaflet delivered by post to every home in Hereford & South Herefordshire for £800. This means that every voter knows that Diana is standing and why. We are particularly keen to inspire the 1 in 3 residents - many of them young people - who didn't even vote in 2010, to do so positively For The Common Good on May 7th.

The Impact

Your donation means that we can counter the negativity and point-scoring with some really positive messages that will appeal to local people, especially younger voters. We believe that low turnout is partly caused by cynicism about the austerity parties. We hope that by offering something genuinely different to austerity and cuts, we can inspire voters to engage more positively.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really can't contribute financially, don't feel bad about it, but perhaps help us in different ways:-

  • Like, follow, share and retweet us on Facebook and Twitter - and encourage more donations to this page and more people to follow us
  • Offer to help with leafleting, canvassing, writing, publicity, hospitality, event organisation and much more - ask us for details
  • You can join the party at concessionary rates if unemployed or a student

Thank you for whatever you can do and for being part of the change you want to see.

If this goal is met, $100,000 of donation money will be put toward launching this book to get it into millions of people's hands who are wanting to start a business on the internet.

In my new book, "From Misery to Millions", I am releasing life-changing, priceless information on how anyone can become an internet millionaire.. and I wanted to ask YOU, the community for financial help in releasing this book!

In return for your donation, I will personally send the PDF version of my new book to anyone who contributes $5.00. For anyone who donates over $50.00, I will send an actual hard copy! Donate over $5,000 and get my personal Skype coaching to build a profitable internet business for you!

I want to put "FUN" into the word "fundraiser", so let's raise the money to help millions while also helping YOU!

Thanks in advance for your donations!

story:
Across the United States, 23,000 people will die in the next 365 days.

And they’ll never see their killer coming. Many of them will walk into their local hospital, expecting treatment for minor injuries like cuts or breaks… or routine procedures like colonoscopies or cesarean sections or day surgeries.

And they’ll never walk out.

Superbugs, stronger than any antibiotic we can throw at them, are spreading faster than we have the capacity to fight back. 2 million people will be infected in the United States this year alone. 23,000 will die.

The End Of Modern Medicine As We Know It

The glory days of antibiotics are over.

Since penicillin was first prescribed 73 years ago, it has saved millions of lives.

But now it’s clear, thanks to the unrestrained use of antibiotics, we’ve unwittingly helped nature breed dangerous strains of superbugs that are, quite literally, killing us.

Our medical system is being driven back to the late 1800s – a time when simple infections kill. And health experts around the globe are beginning to panic, as they’re being backed into corners by strains of superbugs now immune to all known antibiotic treatments.

Doctors are being forced to cut out infections, amputate, and, in worst case scenarios, watch their patients die slow, agonizing deaths.

But it doesn't have to be this way!

With major health organizations predicting death and disease levels comparable to those in the 1800s as superbugs continue to spread around the world, we need to be prepared to look after ourselves.

This is when knowledge of herbal medicine once again becomes priceless.

Because while it’s easy for bacteria to evolve and develop a resistance to single-compound antibiotics, it’s much harder for the same bacteria to outmaneuver the more complex compounds found in herbs.

In herbals you’ll find between 200 and 2000 different compounds working together!

Plants have evolved over hundreds of millions of years with their own combinations of antibacterial, antifungal, antiviral and insecticidal compounds.

So it only makes sense…

… Ancient wisdom that uses combinations of natural herbals to treat infection can, in fact, be more effective than single-compound or even multi-compound antibiotics!

And it’s for this reason, a group of us connected via The [GROW] Network are currently collaborating with some of the most knowledgeable herbalists in the United States to produce a lifesaving video series…

… To teach people without any medical training how to treat common illnesses and injuries with herbal alternatives to antibiotics.

And empower you! So that before death comes knocking… 

And before you are backed into a corner and forced to take someone you love into a superbug-plagued hospital because you didn’t know what to do… 

… You’ll have learned the secrets to using Mother Nature’s natural antibiotics and remedies to confidently treat simple health concerns at home. With herbals found or grown in your own neighborhood. Or, purchased from a local herbalist.  

Why We Need Your Help?

No one is teaching the old ways of healing any more and we need your help to get this information out to the masses. We've partnered with Doug Simons who lives and breathes this stuff every day and wants to teach us.

"Herbal medicine is our human birthright. These techniques are effective; they have been used and handed down through the generations because they work,"  - Doug Simmons

We'll use the funds raised in order to fund the creation, editing, and procurement of these DVD's so that we can get back to our roots with natural healing.

We could probably set up a sweet tripod and put our iPhones to work shooting this project but we want to present it in a professional way that will do this information the justice is deserves and that costs money.

Risks and challenges

We have hired an amazing producer to make this project happen and everything is on pace to come together.

The editing process can be tricky but the team we've picked has put together many incredible videos series and we're sure that they will present this information in a very entertaining and informative way.

This is the 2nd DVD we've created with Doug and so we are confident that everything will go smoothly and we'll be able to provide you with your rewards in the timeline we've described!

story: George was involved in a collision in the road, aged 10, that led to him dying from catastrophic head injuries the next day.  Weeks prior to this collision, George said if he was to die, he would donate his organs to others. This led to the extension of life for five other people. George loved all things science based, especially the study of space. So  an observatory in his name would be perfect, located within his city of birth - Lancaster, UK

story:
Hello!

Hello there! We are Jabbok Charitable Foundation, a Hong Kong based charity organization that strives to help the visually impaired community both in China and Hong Kong.

Working with the blind community is a cause close to home for us. Our chairman, Edward Yip (葉炳釗), lost his eyesight in 1996, and has since dedicated his energy toward improving the lives of the visually impaired. As a team, we focus on increasing daily accessibility for the visually impaired, as well as facilitating their employment among different communities.




------

The Premise.

The rise of the smartphone has seen our pocket-devices accomplishing more and more every day, and we here at Jabbok see in this a huge potential to spark major and direct improvements in the lives of the visually impaired!

As smartphones get both more available and more versatile, we recognize the ability now for the visually impaired community to perform an increasing amount of previously impossible tasks -- from getting e-books read aloud to getting accurate live-descriptions of their surrounding world.

-----

The Task.

The iPhone is currently the phone-of-choice for many of our visually impaired, largely due to the friendly Accessibility functions (ie Text-to-Speech) integrated into its OS. We are excited now to launch a project with the aim of putting smartphones into the hands of visually impaired students across China, allowing them to access information with unprecedented convenience and accuracy.

-----

Progress.

In the first half of this year alone, we’ve collected and refurbished iPhones and organized a social-service trip to a disabled school in China.


Taking a group of university students with us, we taught the visually impaired students there how to maximise the use their new smartphones to aid both their studies and their daily lives!


-----

Looking Forward.

We are looking for funding to support the project and to fund its goals for the coming year of:

1. Obtaining and refurbishing smartphones for distribution. (We take iPhone 4s and above).

2. Development, testing and distribution of applications built for the visually impaired.

3. Organizing visits to schools for the disabled and educating teachers and students on the use of these smartphones.


We thank you for your kind support and donation as our backers. 

----

Collecting iPhones

If you are considering to upgrade your old iPhone to the new iPhone 6 / 6 Plus, please donate it to us.  Passing it on to the hands of visually impaired students will allow them to read and study readily. 

We look forward to hear from you about donating your iPhone. Contact us at donation@jabbok.org.hk 

Let your iPhone to be used at its maximum potential!

story:
INTRODUCTION

Victor Okuta is a trained primary school teacher, from his experience in the profession, he noticed that young girls were getting pregnant and dropping out out of school because of lack of information about reproductive health and contraceptives. Some were opting for abortion after getting pregnant and because of luck of information, they chose to procure the abortions at backstreet clinics which resulted in a lot of complications which, in most cases led to death. 

This motivated him to form a foundation called SAVE THE GIRL CHILD FOUNDATION which primarily tackles issues of reproductive health and unsafe abortion among the youth. The foundation has been in operation for the  past 8 months.

SITUATION.

In Kenya, unsafe abortion is one of the leading causes of death and injury to women and young girls and this can be prevented through advocacy and training of the youth.

Almost all abortions in Kenya result from unintended pregnancies which, just like the rest of Africa, its prevalence rate is too high throughout Kenya. From studies conducted, it showed that 465,000 induced abortions occurred annually, and from this, 120,000 received care for complications and the numbers are increasing daily. More than 3/4 of the complications were severe, and shockingly, 45% of women who received post-abortion care were aged 19 and below and they experienced severe complications which led to death.

It should be noted that, 70% of women who seek post-abortion care did not use any contraceptive prior to becoming pregnant and this is what Victor wants to change.

WHAT HE NEEDS

Victor is seeking a donation of $ 100,000 from well wishers. This donation will be used to carry out training's and forums about reproductive health and safe abortions in all the 47 counties in Kenya. Each county needs at least $ 2,127.66 to conduct a successful forum. This money will be used for hiring venues and setting up tents, giving out incentives (T-shirts, pens, note-pads, umbrellas and caps) in order to motivate the youth to attend. He intends to feed the attendants because the forum will be throughout the day and also marketing and promoting the forums in the county in order to have a wide outreach to the youth.

CONCLUSION.

The persistence of unsafe abortion is a serious threat to the sexual and reproductive health and rights guaranteed to Kenyan women and men under the constitution enacted in 2010. Improved access to comprehensive abortion care, including counseling and effective contraceptive access and use, will both save women’s lives and reduce costs to Kenya’s overburdened healthcare system. Help Victor give our youth information about reproductive heath and safe abortion because with right information, the youth can make correct choices.

story:
Empowering mothers in urban slums to take control of their child’s early development.

Every mom wants to help her baby grow into a strong, healthy and educated kid. In urban slum environments, a mom often doesn’t have the time, money or literacy to be her baby’s learning partner. But she DOES have a mobile phone and the drive to ensure her child has a good life.

Dost, or 'friend' in Hindi, is a mobile-enabled support system designed to equip mothers with the tools to improve their child's cognitive development and school-readiness. 

Using simple IVR technology, Dost will enable parents to track and improve their child’s mental and physical development from pregnancy through primary school age. Through short, pre-recorded audio messages with an educational, nutritional, or mental health related tip customized to the parent and child’s personal profile, parents will have access to relatable and relevant information.


Why fund us?

We need funds to conduct market research and pilot our product in India this summer. Along with the pilot, we will work within urban communities to better understand their needs and willingness to pay for a mobile solution for early childhood education.

Specifically, we need to raise $5,000 to launch a pilot this summer in which 20 families living in low-income urban communities will receive our service offering for one month. We believe the only way we can ensure this product is having an impact is to see how a small group of families interact with it over and over. The funds raised here will support travel costs, product development costs, and hiring one local intern who is embedded in the communities we seek to serve.

The Impact

Customer interviews conducted thus far reveal a willingness to pay $1 per month per child in low-income Indian communities. We have seen first-hand that every parent wants their baby to grow strong in both mind and body. Often, a parent doesn’t have the time, resources or literacy to be the learning partner they want to be or send their child to pre-school. Dost is a low-cost option for parents to track and improve their child’s cognitive development from pregnancy through primary school age. By partnering with content experts in education and health, Dost will help disseminate and activate the latest research-backed best practices in child development.

Our Team

Dost is made up of entrepreneurs and educators. Thus far, Dost won first place at UC-Berkeley’s Hult Prize competition (December 2014) and was a runner-up in the San Francisco regional finals (March 2015). Through the Hult Prize competition pitches, entrepreneurship and technology courses at Berkeley-Haas, and Better Ventures Start-up School at Impact Hub Oakland (Spring 2015), the Dost team has conducted customer interviews and built a prototype. With your support, we aim to establish proof of concept through this summer’s pilot.

In addition to support from the UC Berkeley ecosystem, we are fortunate to have mentors and support from the following organizations who are deeply immersed in social entrepreneurship and education in India:

  • Teach For India
  • Zaya Learning Labs
  • Dasra
story_txt:
Empowering mothers in urban slums to take control of their
child’s early development.
Every mom wants to
help her baby grow into a strong, healthy and educated kid. In urban slum environments, a mom often
doesn’t have the time, money or literacy to be her baby’s learning partner. But
she DOES have a mobile phone and the drive to ensure her child has a good life.

Dost, or 'friend' in Hindi, is a
mobile-enabled support system designed to equip mothers with the tools to
improve their child's cognitive development and school-readiness. 
Using simple IVR
technology, Dost will enable parents to track and improve their child’s mental
and physical development from pregnancy through primary school age. Through
short, pre-recorded audio messages with an educational, nutritional, or mental
health related tip customized to the parent and child’s personal profile,
parents will have access to relatable and relevant information.
Why fund us?
We need funds to
conduct market research and pilot our product in India this summer. Along with
the pilot, we will work within urban communities to better understand their
needs and willingness to pay for a mobile solution for early childhood
education. 
Specifically, we need
to raise $5,000 to launch a pilot this summer in which 20 families living in
low-income urban communities will receive our service offering for one month.
We believe the only way we can ensure this product is having an impact is to
see how a small group of families interact with it over and over. The funds
raised here will support travel costs, product development costs, and hiring
one local intern who is embedded in the communities we seek to serve.
The Impact
Customer interviews
conducted thus far reveal a willingness to pay $1 per month per child in
low-income Indian communities. We have seen first-hand that every parent wants their baby to grow
strong in both mind and body. Often, a parent doesn’t have the time, resources

child development.

are fortunate to have mentors and support from the following organizations who

Teach For India

story:
Mental Health awareness is on the rise in North America and all around the world, but it is still a battle to be seen as debilitating disease. Funding for those with mental health issues is limited from the government, and sometimes outright ignored. Yet every day can be a struggle and performing well in your studies while trying to find a job to cover expenses is incredibly difficult. 


As such I am in need of basic necessities such as food and rent money while I continue to work with the Government of Canada to help receive funding. 


I am student of microbiology and love my studies, every day is an exciting adventure for me. Yet not every day is easy, as I suffer from severe Obsessive Compulsive Disorder. This makes finding jobs difficult as many place me in high stress environments that I may not be able to tolerate to the same degree a high functioning member of society can. 


I understand that many people have private and personal issues that affect them, and maybe you know someone who also suffers from mental health. I would appreciate any help I can get so that i am not evicted from my home and I have an equal chance to complete my education.
