story:
Deutscher Text/German text

What is DaSinD online?

DaSinD online (short for “Datenbank Schriftstellerinnen in Deutschland, Österreich, Schweiz 1945-2008“ or “Database Women Writers in Germany, Austria, Switzerland 1945-2008“ in English) is an online database which records the biographies and bibliographies of women writers and translators, who published poetry and fiction in the German-speaking world between 1945 and 2008. Compared to other literary databases and encyclopedias DaSinD online has two benefits:

1) It records all women writers in its designated time period with their works regardless of financial success or literary fame. That way an almost complete overview of literary works by women writers is formed.

2) The available data can be searched and organized according to multiple criteria chosen by the user.

Who uses DaSinD online?

DaSinD online is a comprehensive work of reference for literary scholars, linguists and historians as well as gender and social scientists. It provides information for agencies, houses of literature, publishers, literary societies and clubs. DaSinD online is also interesting for literature fans with questions concerning the women writers “behind the books”.

By now research libraries in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Spain, the Netherlands, Belgium, the USA, Canada and Taiwan grant their users access to DaSinD online.

While DaSinD online is currently only available in German our data is broken down into notes that can be easily translated with all current (online) dictionaries.

What is this about?

Currently DaSinD online contains the different names, places and dates of birth and death as well as the works of authors. However, in our internal 

work database a lot more biographical data has accumulated. The difference in content is best shown in direct comparison:

For special questions you have to contact us so we search our database and then send the results to you. This is impractical and time-consuming. We want you to be able to do your research yourself. However because our database was largely created with the help of semiskilled contributors the data needs to be professionally redacted before it can be included in DaSinD online. For that we need your help.

Goals and Stretch Goals for the Relaunch of DaSinD online

If we do not reach our goal any raised funds will be used to introduce as much new data into DaSinD online as possible.

Rewards

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if DaSinD online is not for you because you do not speak German, are not interested in the biographies of women writers or are currently low on funds you can still help by spreading the word.

Who are we?

The Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. (Foundation Women's Literature Research e.V.) was founded in 1986 as a charitable, non-profit and non-governmental organization. Members and contributors provide a small foundation for everyday items like office supplies for example. The revenues of DaSinD online's user fees are used to award short-term contracts for work.

Simultaneously with its work on DaSinD online the Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. publishes the Inter-Lit series of papers. This series consists of monographs and anthologies about literary questions concerning the role of women in literature and the positioning of women writers in the German-language literary scene.

The Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. also hosts conventions, takes part in conferences at home and abroad and is interconnected with cultural and academic institutions.

What is so special about DaSinD online?

Free online encyclopedias and the databases of special libraries or archives are using exclusion criteria like the reputation of the writers, the number of publications, the reaction of the media, the renown of the publisher etc. The data for DaSinD online on the other hand is collected purposefully and as broadly as possible at the same time, following scientific criteria. The goal is to record all women writers and their works. Every author is considered, regardless of her financial success or her literary fame. That way an almost complete overview of literary works by women writers is formed. Our database allows to comfortably link multiple questions and combine them into complex subject areas.

A few examples of questions for papers that could be answered using the work database:

  • How many and which works were written by women writers in Low German during the last 10 years? (Master's thesis)

  • How many and which women writers were daughters of writers? (Query of a reader circle)

  • Which female journalists also considered themselves writers and published in the time between 1880 and 1950? (PhD thesis)

  • How are gender roles received and presented in the literature of German-language women writers? Which correlations between life and work of women writers can be recognized? (Project for an essay collection)

  • Memories of flight and displacement in post-war literature. A comparison of the witness generation and that of their grandchildren. (Master's thesis)

To make the linking of searches available for all users the data has to be redacted and introduced into DaSinD online. Since the database was started in 1986 a huge amount of biographical data has been accumulated in the internal biographical work database: More than 38.000 data sets.

This data is necessary to be able to assign the works to the right authors. That is why the work database contains information about

  • Names

  • Dates of birth and death

  • Personal data (family relations and friendships)

  • Education and career

  • Locations, events and activities of special biographic interest

  • Grants and awards

  • References of pictures or photographs (portraits of women writers)

In DaSinD online however, there is so far only information on

  • Names – all occurring name forms and pseudonyms

  • Dates of birth and death

  • Places of birth and death

  • References of pictures or photographs (portraits of women writers)

Why can't the data simply be transferred from the work database to DaSinD online?

Since 1986 only semiskilled contributors have added data to the work database. More than a hundred workers (volunteers or financed with subsidies of the Federal Employment Agency) and more than 71 interns have processed the data. The time people were working on the database ranged from 6 weeks, over 6 months to up to 2 years at most. That means that the team had a high turnover rate, which led to deviations in the data's consistency.

For an efficient research feature certain unifying criteria have to be adhered to – that's why a redaction is necessary. For this we need well-trained personnel that can focus on conducting the redaction and has to be paid.

More questions?

If you have any more questions feel free to contact us through our website, Facebook or Twitter.

Deutscher Text/German Text


Was ist DaSinD online?

DaSinD online (kurz für „Datenbank Schriftstellerinnen in Deutschland, Österreich, Schweiz 1945-2008“) ist eine Online-Datenbank, in der Schriftstellerinnen und Übersetzerinnen, die zwischen 1945 und 2008 im deutschsprachigen Raum Belletristik (wie z.B. Romane, Kurzgeschichten, Gedichte, Hörspiele) veröffentlicht haben, mit Biographien und Werkverzeichnissen erfasst sind. Im Vergleich zu anderen Datenbanken und Lexika hat DaSinD online zwei Vorteile:

1) Es werden alle Schriftstellerinnen und ihre Werke im angegebenen Zeitraum aufgenommen, unabhängig von ihrem Ansehen, finanziellen Erfolg oder dem Renommee ihres Verlags. So entsteht ein fast kompletter Überblick über die Werke von Schriftstellerinnen.

2) Die verfügbaren Daten können nach mehreren, von den BenutzerInnen wählbaren, Kriterien durchsucht und organisiert werden.

Wer nutzt DaSinD online?

DaSinD online ist ein umfassendes Nachschlagewerk für Literatur-, Sprach-, Gender- und SozialwissenschaftlerInnen sowie HistorikerInnen. Agenturen, Literaturhäuser, Verlage, Literarische Gesellschaften und Vereine finden hier Informationen. Außerdem ist DaSinD online interessant für Literatur-Begeisterte, die Fragen zu den Schriftstellerinnen „hinter den Werken“ haben.

Wissenschaftliche Bibliotheken in Deutschland, Österreich, der Schweiz, Spanien, den Niederlanden, Belgien, den USA, Kanada und Taiwan ermöglichen inzwischen ihren NutzerInnen Zugriff auf DaSinD online.

Worum geht es hier?

Momentan enthält DaSinD online die verschiedenen Namen, Geburts- und Sterbedaten und -Orte so wie die Werke der Schriftstellerinnen. In unserer internen Arbeitsdatenbank hingegegen haben sich viel mehr biographische Informationen angesammelt. Der Unterschied ist am besten im direkten Vergleich sichtbar:

Für besondere Fragen müssen sie uns kontaktieren, damit wir die Recherche in unserer Datenbank durchführen und ihnen das Ergebnis schicken. Das ist unpraktisch und kostet Zeit. Wir wollen, dass sie ihre Recherchen selbst durchführen können. Da DaSinD, in großen Teilen, mit der Hilfe von angelernten MitarbeiterInnen erstellt wurde, müssen die Daten redaktionell bearbeitet werden, bevor sie in DaSinD online aufgenommen werden können. Dafür brauchen wir ihre Hilfe!

DaSinD online Relaunch - Ziel und Stretch Goals

Auch wenn wir unser Ziel nicht erreichen sollten, wird das gesammelte Geld darauf verwendet, DaSinD online um so viele neue Informationen wie möglich zu erweitern.

Dankeschöns

Andere Arten uns zu helfen

Auch wenn DaSinD online nichts für sie ist, da sie sich nicht für die Biographien von Schriftstellerinnen interessieren oder gerade knapp bei Kasse sind, können sie uns helfen, indem sie andere Leute auf unsere Kampagne aufmerksam machen.

Wer sind wir?

Die Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. wurde 1986 als gemeinnütziger Verein und als Non-Profit-Organisation gegründet. Mitglieder und SpenderInnen sorgen dafür, dass eine kleine Basis für die alltäglichen Dinge wie z.B. Büromaterial vorhanden ist. Mit den Einkünften über die Nutzungsgebühren von DaSinD online können Werkverträge für jeweils einen kleinen Zeitraum vergeben werden.

Parallel zur Arbeit an DaSinD online gibt die Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. die Schriftenreihe Inter-Lit heraus. Die Reihe umfasst Monographien und Sammelbände, die sich mit literaturwissenschaftlichen Fragestellungen zur Rolle von Frauen in der Literatur und der Positionierung von Schriftstellerinnen im deutschsprachigen Literaturbetrieb beschäftigen.

Außerdem richtet die Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. Tagungen aus, beteiligt sich an Konferenzen im In- und Ausland, ist vernetzt mit kulturellen Institutionen und wissenschaftlichen Einrichtungen. 

Was ist so besonders an DaSinD online?

  • Kostenlose Enzyklopädien und die Datenbanken von Spezial-Bibliotheken oder Archiven arbeiten mit Ausschlusskriterien basierend auf der Anzahl der Veröffentlichungen, der Reaktion der Medien, dem Renommee des Verlags oder Ähnlichem. 

    Dagegen werden die Daten für DaSinD online gezielt und zugleich so breit wie möglich gesammelt. Dabei wird nach wissenschaftlichen Kriterien gearbeitet. Ziel ist es, alle Schriftstellerinnen mit ihren Werken zu verzeichnen. Jede Autorin wird unabhängig von ihrem wirtschaftlichen Erfolg oder ihrer literarischen Anerkennung berücksichtigt. So entsteht ein nahezu kompletter Überblick über die literarischen Werke von Autorinnen. Bei den Recherchen in der Datenbank können mehrere Fragestellungen komfortabel verknüpft und zu komplexen Themenbereichen zusammengeführt werden.

    Einige Beispiele für Fragen, die mit der Datenbank für wissenschaftliche Arbeiten beantwortet werden konnten:

    • Wie viele und welche Werke wurden in den letzten 10 Jahren von Schriftstellerinnen auf Plattdeutsch veröffentlicht? (Magisterarbeit)

    • Wie viele und welche Schriftstellerinnen waren Töchter von Schriftstellern oder Schriftstellerinnen? (Anfrage eines Lesezirkels)

    • Welche Journalistinnen verstanden sich ebenfalls als Schriftstellerinnen und publizierten im Zeitraum 1880 bis 1950. (Promotionsprojekt)

    • Wie werden Frauenbilder und Geschlechterrollen in der Literatur deutschsprachiger Autorinnen rezipiert und präsentiert? Welche Wechselwirkungen lassen sich zwischen Leben, Wirken und Werk schreibender Frauen erkennen? (Projekt für eine Aufsatzsammlung)

    • Die Erinnerung an Flucht und Vertreibung in der Literatur der Nachkriegszeit. Die Erlebnisgeneration im Vergleich zur Enkelgeneration. (Magisterarbeit)

    • Warum können nicht einfach die Daten von der Arbeitsdatenbank nach DaSinD online transferiert werden?

    Seit 1986 haben ausschließlich angelernte MitarbeiterInnen die Informationen in die Arbeitsdatenbank eingegeben. Es haben über 100 MitarbeiterInnen (ehrenamtlich oder mit Fördermitteln der Bundesagentur für Arbeit finanziert) und über 71 PraktikantInnen die Daten bearbeitet. Das heißt, manche waren 6 Wochen, 6 Monate oder bis maximal 2 Jahre bei der Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. aktiv. Das bedeutet, dass die Mitglieder in den Teams sehr häufig wechselten und damit verbunden entstanden Abweichungen in der Einheitlichkeit der Daten.

    Für eine funktionierende Recherche müssen bestimmte vereinheitlichende Kriterien eingehalten werden – und so etwas leistet stets eine Redaktion. Dafür benötigen wir gut ausgebildetes Personal, das konzentriert diese Redaktion durchführen und langfristig beschäftigt und entlohnt werden kann.

    Mehr Fragen?

    Bei weiteren Fragen können sie uns jederzeit über unsere Website, Facebook oder Twitter erreichen.

Parallel
zur Arbeit an DaSinD online gibt die Stiftung
Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. die Schriftenreihe Inter-Lit heraus.
Die Reihe umfasst Monographien und Sammelbände, die sich mit
literaturwissenschaftlichen Fragestellungen zur Rolle von Frauen in
der Literatur und der Positionierung von Schriftstellerinnen im
deutschsprachigen Literaturbetrieb beschäftigen. 


Außerdem
richtet die Stiftung Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. Tagungen aus,
beteiligt sich an Konferenzen im In- und Ausland, ist vernetzt mit
kulturellen Institutionen und wissenschaftlichen Einrichtungen. 
Was ist so besonders an DaSinD online?
Kostenlose
	Enzyklopädien und die Datenbanken von Spezial-Bibliotheken oder
	Archiven arbeiten mit Ausschlusskriterien basierend auf der Anzahl
	der Veröffentlichungen, der Reaktion der Medien, dem Renommee des
	Verlags oder Ähnlichem. 
Dagegen
werden die Daten für DaSinD online gezielt und zugleich so breit wie
möglich gesammelt. Dabei wird nach wissenschaftlichen Kriterien
gearbeitet. Ziel ist es, alle Schriftstellerinnen mit ihren Werken zu
verzeichnen. Jede Autorin wird unabhängig von ihrem wirtschaftlichen
Erfolg oder ihrer literarischen Anerkennung berücksichtigt. So
entsteht ein nahezu kompletter Überblick über die literarischen
Werke von Autorinnen. Bei den Recherchen in der Datenbank können
mehrere Fragestellungen komfortabel verknüpft und zu komplexen
Themenbereichen zusammengeführt werden.


Einige
Beispiele für Fragen, die mit der Datenbank für wissenschaftliche
Arbeiten beantwortet werden konnten:




Wie
	viele und welche Werke wurden in den letzten 10 Jahren von
	Schriftstellerinnen auf Plattdeutsch veröffentlicht?
	(Magisterarbeit)


Wie
	viele und welche Schriftstellerinnen waren Töchter von
	Schriftstellern oder Schriftstellerinnen? (Anfrage eines
	Lesezirkels)


Welche
	Journalistinnen verstanden sich ebenfalls als Schriftstellerinnen
	und publizierten im Zeitraum 1880 bis 1950. (Promotionsprojekt)


Wie
	werden Frauenbilder und Geschlechterrollen in der Literatur
	deutschsprachiger Autorinnen rezipiert und präsentiert? Welche
	Wechselwirkungen lassen sich zwischen Leben, Wirken und Werk
	schreibender Frauen erkennen? (Projekt für eine Aufsatzsammlung)


Die
	Erinnerung an Flucht und Vertreibung in der Literatur der
	Nachkriegszeit. Die Erlebnisgeneration im Vergleich zur
	Enkelgeneration. (Magisterarbeit)




Warum
können nicht einfach die Daten von der Arbeitsdatenbank nach DaSinD
online transferiert werden?Seit
1986 haben ausschließlich angelernte MitarbeiterInnen die
Informationen in die Arbeitsdatenbank
eingegeben. Es
haben über 100 MitarbeiterInnen (ehrenamtlich oder mit Fördermitteln
der Bundesagentur für Arbeit finanziert) und über 71
PraktikantInnen die Daten bearbeitet. Das heißt, manche waren 6
Wochen, 6 Monate oder bis maximal 2 Jahre bei der Stiftung
Frauen-Literatur-Forschung e.V. aktiv. Das bedeutet, dass die
Mitglieder in den Teams sehr häufig wechselten und damit verbunden
entstanden Abweichungen in der Einheitlichkeit der Daten.

Für
eine funktionierende Recherche müssen bestimmte vereinheitlichende
Kriterien eingehalten werden – und so etwas leistet stets eine
Redaktion. Dafür benötigen wir gut ausgebildetes Personal, das
konzentriert diese Redaktion durchführen und langfristig beschäftigt
und entlohnt werden kann.Mehr Fragen?Bei weiteren Fragen können sie uns jederzeit über unsere Website, Facebook oder Twitter erreichen.

story:
I'm an artist that has gotten into grad school now what? "How to fund it?"  is the question when one already has a pile of student debt from their undergrad degree.  Sadly, I'm not alone. It got me to thinking though about a debate that is finally starting to gain awareness in our government and talked about in our country. Why is the cost of education so high and why are students left with so much crippling debt?

In an effort to find a creative means to finance my education and further my art career, but also raise awareness about what it takes to try to get your education paid for here in the U.S., Ive started this campaign. Why is my choice, get more money or not be able to attend a university that would help me advance myself? Why is that not only my decision but the question thousands of other students are facing?

If my campaign gets funded I will donate $8,000 of it toward another student that is in the same position as myself. I will also donate $2,000 to the Student Debt Crisis Campaign which has been doing an excellent job of pushing for change and aid for student debt.  If I am even HALF funded, I will still donate $2,000 to Student Debt Crisis.


See my artwork here: http://reneevalenti.com/home.html

story:
For the past five years, students from the American University of Paris have been working with AJMJTO, an association for youth development in Ile Sainte Marie, Madagascar. In an effort to increase our contribution and create a long-term, self-sustainable income for the entire community on the island, a group of six from the university will travel there in August and establish a social entrepreneurship. AJMJTO has already raised funds to build a school for the students in Ilampy, who previously had to walk 7 km each way to get to school. Now they can enjoy an education, and we want to support the students in their endeavors by raising enough funds to provide the children with school supplements. Above all, our first step is to get funds to buy raincoats for the children for the rainy season. HELP US get the children raincoats! Estimated price to purchase one raincoat from the markets in Antananarivo for an Ilampy student is $5. A documentary will be released online at the end of our trip! Your contribution matters!



Depuis 5 ans maintenant, les élèves de l'Université Américaine de Paris travaillent avec l'Association des Jeunes Malgaches et des Jeunes de Toutes Origines, une association qui travaille pour le développement de la jeunesse sur l'ile Sainte Marie, au large des cotes de Madagascar. Afin d'augmenter notre contribution et créer un partenariat à long terme pour l'ensemble de la communauté sur l'ile, un groupe de six de l'université s'y rendra en Aout.

AJMJTO a pour but d’une part, de promouvoir le sport et d’autre part, de mener des actions visant à développer l’entraide entre les jeunes des pays riches et les jeunes issus des pays en voie de développement. L'année 2013 a été marquée par l'aboutissement du projet "Une Ecole pour les Enfants d'Ilampy" puisque les enfants devaient marcher 7km avant de rejoindre avant l'école la plus proche. Ilampy est un village situé sur l'ile Sainte Marie  Madagascar. L'école a été inauguré le 1er Octobre 2013, aujourd'hui plus de 140 enfants issus de familles défavorisées y sont dorénavant scolarisés.

Notre première étape consiste à trouver des fonds pour acheter 140 k-ways aux 140 enfants de l'école pour la saison des pluies. AIDEZ NOUS à y arriver. L'estimation d'un k-way à Llampy coute environ 5 dollars. Un documentaire sera produit à la fin de notre voyage, Votre contribution COMPTE!!






Previous Work
AJMJTO, Association des Jeunes Malagesh et des Jeunes de Toutes Origines,

 strives to create social initiatives for disadvantaged communities, managed by local partners. Their project "Une Ecole pour les Enfants d'Ilampy » on the Island Sainte Marie, which was inaugurated on  Octobre 1st,  2013, has now more than 140 children from disadvantaged families that have now access to education. Since then, the school has been fully operational, and they are currently installing solar panels to provide the school with sustainable electricity. The island is small but has more than 27,000 inhabitants and lacks schools in terms of inhabitants. AJMTO’s biggest oncoming projects include building a cafeteria for the children so that they can get access to healthy food and accommodations for teachers who live far away from the school.


Un projet de construire une cantine scolaire pour que les enfants puissent manger équilibré mais aussi des logements pour les enseignants qui habitent loin de l'école est en cours, si les moyens le permettent.


Every year, the American University of Paris organizes a charity run of 7 km in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, to raise awareness and funds for the children in Ile Sainte Marie who previously were forced to walk that distance every day to get to school. This year, we raised 1350 euros for AJMJTO, and we intend to build on the tradition by increasing the number of runners next year, following our expanded collaboration with AJMJTO.

Chaque année, AUP organise une semaine de "charité" dont l'une des journées consiste en un marathon de 7km dans Paris pour sensibiliser et trouver des fonds pour les enfants de l'Ile Saint Marie qui étaient obliger de marcher 7km pour rejoindre l'école la plus proche. Cette année, nous avons obtenu 1350 euros pour AJMJTO and nous avons le projet d'augmenter le nombre de coureurs l'année prochaine.


Objective

AUP’s role in the collaboration is to identify needs in the community in which they operate and find solutions to those needs, to develop it into a for-profit social entrepreneurship, with the goal of creating sustainable incentives that will benefit the entire community in Ile Sainte-Marie. 


Our Team from the American University of Paris

Joelle Gëwolb, Student Leadership Coordinator
Mehdi Majidi,  Director of the Cross-Cultural and Sustainable Business Management Program and Head of the International Business Department.
Hope Stewart and Rachel Fallon, Master Candidates
Amanda Skaar and Marie Robin, Bachelor Candidates

After our trip, we will release a short documentary presenting the results and thanking you for your contribution!

Après notre voyage, nous publierons un petit documentaire présentant les résultats et vous remerciant de votre contribution!

story:
Landon was diagnosed with autism and severe ADHD in November of 2013. He loved his ipad in the past but because of his clumsiness and meltdowns, it was broken after over a year of using it. Unfortunately, we cannot simply walk into a store and buy an ipad like we did in the past due to the cost and our current working situation due to trying to take care of a child with special needs. 

  His iPad helped calm him down, especially when he was becoming hyperactive. It also helped him learn sooo much and was often the only way he could focus on learning. Because of it, he is a very smart boy who started kindergarten explaining the differences between spheres and trapezoids. Two other cheaper tablets and 5+ months later, he is still majorly missing his ipad. Getting a new one would be very beneficial to him as we now have a diagnosis and have had various apps recommended to us that are great for autism specifically. 

 Landon would also benefit from some additional tools to help him concentrate in school such as weighted lap pads (to remind him to try to sit still), fidget pencils (which would help him concentrate more on tasks) , locator (because he is a runner and is often unaware of danger), and vestibular items because he loves to jump and spin in circles. 

Please help Landon receive tools that would help him out soooo much! Thanks!

Thanks!

story:
Hello!

We are Crystal Davila and Lucy Griswold and we have launched a branch of Students United for Public Education at the University of Texas at Austin.  Students United for Public Education (SUPE) is an organization that advocates for issues relating to K-12 public education at the college level. 

SUPE understands that a profit motive cannot guarantee a good education. Instead, only a robust and well-supported public education system — along with the courage and will to directly confront problems of racial and economic inequality — can provide a quality education for all.

Crystal is currently completing her undergraduate degree in Math, Urban Studies and UTeach Math.  Lucy graduated from UT with a B.A. in Government and Liberal Arts Honors in May and is now pursuing a Masters in Urban Education and Curriculum and Instruction in the school of education.  We are asking you to donate and join us in the struggle to provide a teaching and learning environment that is inspiring, emancipatory and democratic for all!


What We Need & What You Get 

In order to get our group off the ground, we need resources!  So far, we have been putting our own money into all organizational costs and self-producing all materials and displays.  In order to advance our organization and its cause we need your support!

We are hoping to raise a total of $1,200 to fund:

  • Banner - $100
  • Printing costs: $200
  • Initial fund for speakers, activist trainings and workshops: $240
  • Refreshements for meetings, panels, and teach-ins: $400
  • Input costs of branded materials: $250
  • University fees: $50
  • Indiegogo fess: $60
Donating to our campaign comes with some great perks!  Members of SUPE Austin created custom illustrations that will be printed on several practical items for your everyday use.  Note which illustration you would like printed with your donation! 
#1

#2

#3

#4


  • $3 - Receive a personal shout out on our new blog "What's SUPe?"
  • $5 - Receive a digital download of any of the four illustrated postcards produced by SUPE and a shout out on our blog.
  • $15 - Receive a printed SUPE illustration of your choice printed on 4x6 photo-grade printer paper, all digital downloads and a shoutout on our blog.
  • $25 - Receive a SUPE button or keychain with SUPE's signature logo, a 4x6 illustration of your choice, all digital downloads and a shoutout on our blog.
  • $50 - Receive handwritten SUPE postcard from SUPE member, a SUPE button or keychain with SUPE's signature logo, a 4x6 illustration of your choice, all digital downloads and a shoutout on our blog.
  • $100 - Receive a screen printed T-shirt with SUPE illustration, a handwritten SUPE postcard from SUPE member, a SUPE button or keychain with SUPE's signature logo, a 4x6 illustration of your choice, all digital downloads and a shoutout on our blog.
  • $200 - A SUPE member will write, perform and post a video of themself doing slam poetry on an education topic of your choice, receive a screen printed T-shirt with SUPE illustration, a handwritten SUPE postcard from SUPE member, a SUPE button or keychain with SUPE's signature logo, a 4x6 illustration of your choice, all digital downloads and a shoutout on our blog.
  • $300 - Have a photo of your choice turned into an illustration by SUPE house artist and all of the above!


    Risks & Challenges

    Getting a new student group off of the ground comes with its difficulties.  At UT Austin, there are literally over 1,000 registered student organizations on campus and competing for student participation can be tough.  Given that no organization of this kind exists and that there are thousands of graduate and undergraduate students on campus pursuing education, we feel that we can establish an active and sustained group on campus that will be replicating this important work for years ahead! 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't give money please consider spreading our campaign on Facebook and liking our groups Facebook page (SUPE ATX).  If you are interested in getting involved in SUPE or starting a SUPE chapter on your campus contact:

      SUPEcontact@gmail.com

story: We are YOUR safer space! We are your last info shop in town, here for your group's meetings, your band's shows, your self defense class, your workshops, to provide you with great political books and zines and in general to support you in whatever way we can! Your contributions will allow us to buy more books, pay for much needed maintenance and carpet, and most importantly to pay for back rent and bills  so we can stay open and keep on serving this awesome community!

story:
Summary

 Your funds will go to help to raise funds for the war torn repatriated and underprivileged kids of Carolyn Miller High School in Paynesville, Liberia, West Africa. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

NoHo FUMC is hosting a free event in the hopes of raising funds that will help provide continuous support to bring more relief, joy and possibilities to underprivileged kids at Carolyn Miller High School in Paynesville, Liberia.  For now, our goal is $2,000 to help cultivate global citizens.

Entertainers for Education
What: Free Concert
Date:  Saturday, August 23rd
Time: 2:00 - 3:30pm
Address: 4832 Tujunga Ave, North Hollywood, CA 91601
Purpose: Fundraising for underprivileged kids at Carolyn Miller High School in Paynesville, Liberia.

Donations Welcomed!
*If you can’t attend in person we will post the entire concert on our indigogo page.

The Impact

 

Liberia is currently ranked the 2nd most miserable place in the world to live.

The country’s unemployment rate is more than 75-percent; illiteracy affects about 80% of the population (70% of the entire population is under the age of 27). Additionally, about 80-percent of the population lives on less than $1 a day. 

Carolyn High relies purely on the support and donations of good Samaritans to provide education to this depressed area.

Risks & Challenges

Francis Jaway, the coordinator of this event, grew up in Africa and struggled through 5 years of the brutal Liberian civil war. This 14-year-long conflict ended up claiming the lives of several of his family members. He came to the US as a college student and eventually called LA his new home, but has kept his motherland close in his heart. With the help of fellow entertainers and the NoHo FUMC, he is hoping to raise funds that are desperately needed in a co-ed school that promotes global citizenship.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to donate money, but if you live in the LA area please attend our free event. We just want to spread the word about this wonderful institution and the more folks we have there the merrier. If you don't live in SoCal, or can't attend the event, please share our indigogo page.

Summary Your funds will go to help to raise funds for the war torn repatriated and underprivileged kids of  Carolyn Miller High School in Paynesville, Liberia, West Africa.    What We Need & What You Get 
NoHo FUMC is hosting a free event in the hopes of raising funds that will help provide continuous support to bring more relief, joy and possibilities to underprivileged kids at Carolyn Miller High School in Paynesville, Liberia.  For now, our goal is $2,000 to help cultivate global citizens. 
Entertainers for EducationWhat: Free ConcertDate:  Saturday, August 23rdTime: 2:00 - 3:30pmAddress: 4832 Tujunga Ave, North Hollywood, CA 91601Purpose: Fundraising for underprivileged kids at Carolyn Miller High School in Paynesville, Liberia.
Donations Welcomed!*If you can’t attend in person we will post the entire concert on our indigogo page.
  The Impact 

Liberia is currently ranked the
2nd most miserable place in the world to live.
The country’s unemployment
rate is more than 75-percent; illiteracy affects about 80% of the population
(70% of the entire population is under the age of 27). Additionally, about 80-percent of the
population lives on less than $1 a day.  
Carolyn High relies purely on
the support and donations of good Samaritans to provide education to this
depressed area. 
  Risks & Challenges Francis Jaway, the coordinator of this event, grew up in Africa and struggled through 5 years of the brutal Liberian civil war. This 14-year-long conflict ended up claiming the lives of several of his family members. He came to the US as a college student and eventually called LA his new home, but has kept his motherland close in his heart. With the help of fellow entertainers and the NoHo FUMC, he is hoping to raise funds that are desperately needed in a co-ed school that promotes global citizenship.
  Other Ways You Can Help We understand that not everyone can afford to donate money, but if you live in the LA area please attend our free event. We just want to spread the word about this wonderful institution and the more folks we have there the merrier. If you don't live in SoCal, or can't attend the event, please share our indigogo page.

story:
A Little History About My Passion For Birth

Hey there big world, my name is Ariel and I’ve got a passion for women’s health! One year ago I decided to take that passion and make it into a career by training to become a doula (childbirth assistant) and sex health educator. It was not a natural choice when I already had a cushy desk job with a solid paycheck; but after cradling a woman in my arms near a shooting, I realized I was better fit to manage a crisis than a computer. I traded that paycheck in for a sense of fulfillment when I decided to help educate women on their reproductive path from adolescence into motherhood. I started this journey with the kind words of support from my friends and have funded over half of the total costs by myself, and now I realize that I can’t do this with encouragement alone.

When people ask me “Why choose this field?” I tell them about the 3 E’s: Education, Empowerment and Encouragement.

  • Education - All women deserve to know about their bodies from a credible source based on current evidence whether for legal rights or available treatment options.
  • Empowerment – When knowledge and resources are readily available, women are able to confidently make informed decisions, find courage to speak to their health care providers, and feel secure that they forged a path that’s right for them. It’s a strength like no other!
  • Encouragement – Sometimes you need more than a coach, you need a friend. Someone to say they believe in you, that you are strong, that you CAN do this! Whatever is right for you, I will support you to make it happen.

Women all over the world deserve this treatment, so I plan to take this trade with me overseas to areas that have clinics in need and disaster zones where reproductive health services have been wiped out.

While there isn’t an official degree for this dual role of sex health educator and doula, there are certifications and trainings required and a fair amount of expense goes with them. I’ve already completed and self-funded the heftiest courses; however, I've fallen on hard times and only have enough funds left to complete either my DONA certification OR my international training in Glastonbury, England. Without the necessary funds to complete my certifications I cannot offer the full spectrum of services that women deserve.

How You Can Help

By donating a few dollars, you're helping me complete an education that will literally be invested in our future as I escort women into motherhood. 

  • $1000 for my UK birth doula course - I've already paid the $1600 for the class itself but need help to retain lodging, food and travel expenses.
  • $500 to complete my DONA certification here in the states - breastfeeding class, membership fee, application fee, required reading materials, etc.
  • $200 for marketing materials - brochures, website costs, business cards
  • $300 for courses yet to take like mama/baby massage, aromatherapy and essential oils for pregnancy, placenta encapsulation, CPR/first aid certification renewal, postpartum doula certification and prenatal/postpartum nutrition. $300 will not cover all of these courses, a couple at best, so any additional funds that exceed my goal will be invested in further education.

    The Perks

    Are you wondering what YOU get out of donating to the cause? Well, helping to educate and create a well-rounded doula could lead to YOU or someone you love having me in their corner when one of the most important times in their life is at hand. Studies have shown that doulas positively effect birth outcomes, plus I will be there teaching future generations about how to care for their own bodies and respect their partners. I will be there distributing birth control when hospital clinics are wiped out from natural disasters.

    There are perks for $5, 10, 20, 50, 100 and 200 donations so there's an amount for any sized pocketbook. **NOTE** If you donate anonymously I can't properly glomp or send you goodies, which is fine if you like to stay incognito but I just wanted you to know :)

    Along the way I will be updating my website with my journey to complete my certifications so you can travel with me!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand that not everyone can contribute financially no matter how much they may want to - hey I've been there! Even $5 helps, so don't feel obligated to empty your wallet for me or put yourself in a pinch. Conversely, if you or someone you know is expecting a new bundle of joy, please send them to my website so they can learn how a doula may benefit their birth and set up a free consultation.

    If you know of a course that may be of interest, or perhaps can share personal tips with me on volunteering overseas/marketing/etc. I'd love to hear them!

    Anything you're able to offer is greatly appreciated as I venture into exciting new territory as a doula and sex health educator!

story:
This is my Nephew and niece Robbie and Michelle Howell's new baby!

Baby was born June 13th by emergency C Section at 26 1/2 weeks and has been in the hospital in the NICU ever since.  They have been driving aprx. 40 min each way daily and sometimes more often than that.  They have 2 other children at home.  The gas alone is really draining on them! 
Mom has to quit her job to be able to care for the baby once she is released from the hospital.  Baby can NOT go into daycare.  
We asked for $500 because we did not know what to ask for though the expenses far exceed this amount.  Any help would be appreciated. If you can not give financially you can still help by sharing this with your friends and family. Prayers are also MUCH appreciated! Parents tell everyone that is why she has made it this far doing so well.  Let's make this go viral so they can get the help they desperately need! Thanks so much!

story:
About the Chicago Free School

  • We are a democratic free school on the South Side of Chicago.
  • At the Chicago Free School, students choose their classes and activities based on their individual interests.  We do not have required classes, grades, or standardized tests.
  • Students participate in democratic decision-making to create school rules, resolve conflicts, and suggest topics to study.
  • Our small size of about 55 students with 5 full-time teachers ensures that students get lots of personal attention in a caring community.
  • We emphasize learning that is authentic, exploratory, and connected to the community. Our location in central Hyde Park is ideal for accessing local parks and museums and taking public transit on field trips throughout the city.
  • We are committed to social justice and racial and socioeconomic diversity. We offer sliding-scale tuition so that we are affordable for every family, regardless of income.  We serve a diverse community of students and families.
  • Families tell us that we fulfill an urgent need for a new kind of school for their children. Your donations help us keep our school affordable to everyone through sliding-scale tuition.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money from this campaign funds our continued operational expenses - teacher salaries, books, furniture, and learning supplies. 
  • The money we raise helps us continue our sliding-scale tuition so that our school can be affordable for every family.
  • Our thank-you gifts to you feature our logo.
  • We are a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, so your gift is tax-deductible.

The Impact

  • In our current climate of high-stakes test pressure and resource cuts, it is increasingly difficult for many schools to meet the social and emotional needs of students and provide an environment where learning can be authentic and fun.  Families choose Chicago Free School because it gives students the autonomy and flexibility to pursue their own interests in a supportive community.
  • Free School students grow up to be self-possessed, caring, self-motivated adults and truly engaged citizens.
  • Our teachers apply their years of experience serving Chicago's students to create a school that really meets the needs of children in a caring, joyful environment. 
  • Our school functions as a truly democratic community - we involve students, parents, and teachers in making decisions and give everyone a voice.

Challenges

Facing unexpected construction to get our building up to code, we have begun our year in a temporary space.  Your donation helps us get to a permanent home!

Help Us Reach Our Goal

  • Your tax-deductible donation of any amount helps us continue to build our school and supports this unique model of education!
  • Any size donation makes a big difference!
  • Please feel free to share our campaign via email or facebook.  You can click the buttons or copy and paste the web address shown in the box.
  • If your employer matches contributions, email or message us and we will send you a digital copy of the W9 form.

story:
About us

We’re a volunteer organization of teachers, chess coaches, parents, and school administrators. And we want to give every kid in Chicago the opportunity to learn, play and compete in chess, so we created the Chicago Chess Foundation, (CCF) a 501(c)(3) nonprofit.

We know that chess teaches important life skills and we want to give that opportunity to thousands of children living in Chicago.

By supporting Rook, Rattle & Roll you’ll be helping kids in under­-funded schools learn critical thinking skills by providing chess grants for the 2015-­16 academic cycle.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to provide assistance for up to 10 underfunded Chicago area schools, at a cost of about $1,500 per school. With your help, Rook, Rattle & Roll will provide Chicago students:

  • Scholastic chess sets
  • A chess mentor
  • Team t-shirts
  • Instructional materials
  • Assistance with tournament fees
  • Help starting after-school chess clubs

Any funds raised will be put toward helping as many schools as possible.

We want to thank you for your support with Perks linked to your contributions. The Perks include thank you notes, branded chess sets, one-on-one instruction with a Chess Master and the opportunity to hand out trophies at one of our chess tournaments.



The Impact

Forty years of research has shown learning and playing chess helps kids with:

  • Test scores and academic performance
  • Concentration
  • Decision-making
  • Problem solving
  • Creativity
Our mission to bring chess to Chicago schools will be critical this academic year because Chicago Public Schools was recently forced to cut funding for sports and other after-school activities such as chess. Rook, Rattle & Roll will help to sustain and expand chess despite these cuts. Our foundation is also taking steps to promote chess through free chess tournaments, workshops and Summer camps.



Risks & Rewards

We seek to ensure the lessons of chess belong to all Chicago children, regardless of neighborhood or socioeconomic background. And we guarantee children nurtured through Rook, Rattle & Roll will receive the support they need to be winners in chess and winners in life.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, there are still ways you can help. Like our Facebook page or visit our website. Most importantly, help us get the word out! Share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family!
We thank you for your support.

story:
INTRODUCTION

The exact relationship of contemporary mindfulness practices to more traditional Buddhist psychological theories remains a complex and contested issue in various academic, clinical, religious, and popular contexts. Here you have the chance to contribute to the ongoing and in-depth exploration of this subject in theory and practice and also to receive future updates on this process in return. The goal of this campaign thus is to raise €3.868 for my participation in the Bodhi College's Mindfulness Teachers' Development Programme.  

BACKGROUND

My academic background actually is in Tibetan and Buddhist Studies, and I have been working as an assistant librarian for the South Asian, Tibetan and Buddhist Studies Library of the University of Vienna. Besides this, I have also gathered substantial experience in translating texts from Tibetan and Sanskrit, editing academic publications, and interpreting for Buddhist teachers.

As part of my continuing education, I have recently completed a basic mindfulness training course and I am also undergoing preparatory psychotherapy training, in the context of which I am currently on a six-month internship at the Oxford Mindfulness Centre.

Here I have recently learned about a unique future training opportunity which is essential in my path towards an engaged yet critical integration of such diverse backgrounds and approaches – and it is in this case that I am asking for your help.

THE CAMPAIGN

The Mindfulness Teachers’ Development Programme (MTDP) is a newly established two-year extended course offered by the Bodhi College. It explores the foundations of mindfulness in Buddhist psychology as well as the ways in which these teachings inform contemporary mindfulness and thus continue to be a pathway to emotional and psychological healing and transformation. (See the link below on detailed information on the MTDP)

Module 1, Contextualising Mindfulness, will explore the foundational texts that underpin all contemporary mindfulness-based interventions and what Buddhist psychology has to offer to contemporary mindfulness teaching. (CH, February 2016)

Module 2, The Existential Challenge, looks at the three universal characteristics - distress, anguish, and struggle as well as impermanence and non-self - and investigate the ways in which self perception and our world of experience is constructed. (UK, October 2016) 

Module 3, The Big Picture, will look how the teachings on the aggregates and dependent arising offer effective conceptual maps to disclose the complexity of what we call “experience" as well as how they open up possibilities for insight and transformation. (CH, February 2017)

Finally, Module 4, Universal Empathy, will explore the four boundless abodes - friendliness, compassion, joy and equanimity - and how these qualities are explicitly cultivated in Buddhist meditative pathways and implicitly taught and developed in contemporary mindfulness-based applications. (UK, October 2017)

COSTS

The costs for the full programme spanning four modules in the UK and Switzerland is €3.868 (£2.791). Additional costs include €762 (£550) for accommodation and an estimated €800 (£577) for travel, amounting to a grand total of approximately €5.430 (£3.918).

The goal of this campaign is to raise the full programme costs of €3.868 (£2.791).

Should that goal be reached before the end of the campaign, my plan is to stretch the goal to cover costs for accommodation and travel as well. If we come up short of the intended goal, the accumulated amount will still go towards the programme costs and I will have to find other ways to finance the outstanding payments.

Please note that the accrued costs for my preliminary mindfulness and psychotherapy training have exceeded €7.500 within the previous two years.

WHY?

This is a unique opportunity for me to continue and deepen my studies and practice with an exceptionally innovative yet well-grounded group of teachers who are at the forefront of combining traditional Buddhist teachings with a critical approach inherited from the Western tradition.

Through my participation in this course, I will be able to identify the core Buddhist teachings underpinning contemporary mindfulness approaches and thus tap the full potential of breadth and depth of mindfulness as a pathway to emotional and psychological change. Understanding theoretically as well experimentally the links between the early teachings of mindfulness and their application today will enable me to connect both of these approaches with my present and future research, practice, and teaching.

This course will thus act as fertile ground for all my future engagements with mindfulness in theory and practice, such as providing mindfulness teaching to individuals and groups in a variety of settings as well as critically reflecting on issues in contemporary mindfulness from a variety of academic backgrounds.

LINKS

https://bodhi-college.org/events/mindfulness-teachers-development-programme-mtdp
https://contemplativemetadata.wordpress.com/
http://dennis-johnson.com/en (The website is having issues with Mozilla Firefox at the moment!)

story:
Click Here to Order

       

Why a throwable microphone, you ask?  The Qball is a fun and dynamic way to engage and interact with your audience, whether that audience is a bunch of fans at a comic book expo, a room full of third graders, or your boss on the other end of that video conference. The fun doesn't stop there, think Corporate Training, Youth Groups, Concerts, Churches, Video Production, and even Karaoke. With the Qball everyone can Be A Part Of It.

Plug and Play

Setting the system up is as easy as connecting our Receiver to your audio system of choice with a standard 3.5mm stereo cable. Still not convinced? Check out this video and I'll walk you through setting it up.

It's a Dodgeball

No, not the big red rubber dodgeballs you're thinking of, but the nice soft squishy one's. Don't worry, it won't hurt you or the Qball if it accidentally gets dropped.

 

Board Room

How many times have we huddled around the conference room mic for those weekly video calls?  With the QBall, you can say goodbye to the days of trying to talk over everyone else in the room. If you've got the ball, you've got the floor.

 

Events

Don't you just love going to events where you have the opportunity to ask that one question that you've been dying to have answered, only to run out of time waiting for the poor guy running the mic around the room? With the Qball you can simply toss the mic (oh and don't worry, we won't interfere with your existing microphones).

 

Classroom

Teachers are constantly searching for fun ways to engage and interact with their students.  As one teacher told us, Kids + Microphones = A Winning Combination. We couldn't agree more. Not only do kids love throwing the microphone around the room, but they actually learn more when everyone can hear what the teacher and their fellow students are saying. And that's just for starters! With just a webcam and the Qball system, you can easily record your lesson and upload it to YouTube for students to access while working on their homework.

 

Karaoke

Everybody knows that Karaoke is always the best when there's somebody with whom to share the humiliatio.... I mean fun!  The Qball ensures that when the party gets rocking, there is no escaping the spotlight.

 

Party Mode

 

Connect your phone or laptop into the audio input and crank your favorite tunes. Our built-in mixer will seamlessly blend the music and your voice for the ultimate mobile party in a box.

 

 

Is This Thing On?

Our Presenter Mic can be used completely independently of the ball. Once you power it on, it will automatically sync to the Receiver. You can clip it onto your shirt, hang it around your neck, or use an external lapel mic and wear it like a belt pack. Our rechargeable battery gives you up to nine hours of talk time, ensuring it will last all day long.

 

Is it Durable?

Did I mention that it's a dodgeball.  The Presenter Mic (the brains) is buried deep inside the Qball and is engineered to take some serious impact.  If the Qball gets dirty, you can simply wipe the ball with soapy water. If the microphone cover ever gets ripped or torn, replacements are available at a minimal cost.

 

What Are People Saying About The Qball

 

“This is such a fun and easy way to keep the students attention and participation during class.”

“Talk about upping classroom participation!!! I don't want this. I need this!!!”

“OMG this is BRILLIANT! I am starting a gofundme and a donorschoose, so I can have one for my babies...lol! I want this sooo bad!”

“This is amazing!! Teacher's rooms? PTO events too?”

“I would love if my school could be added to the list for a donation of this amazing product that could change my students lives!”

“Shut up and take my money!!!”

“These are so fun. .. kids will love them.”
 

Risks and Challenges

We have already finalized the design and created several working prototypes. So all we need to do now is to is send the Qball to the manufacturer. We have been working with multiple factories to ensure our timelines are achievable, but there is always the possibility of unforeseen problems in bringing manufacturing of any new product online. Our pledge to you is that we will be completely transparent with any challenges that we encounter. My other promise is that whether we successfully raise our 30K goal or we blow it out of the water and raise millions, you the backer will always be our number one priority.

 

The Team

story:
It is difficult to imagine Berkeley Preparatory School without Kathi Grau and Bruce "Doc" LeBaron. Will the faculty and student body ever rally around an event like we did for Kathi's epic Spring Musicals? Who will teach the joy and camaraderie that comes from singing with our peers like Doc? At a time in our lives when we were so inclined to segregate into cliques, Kathi and Doc brought us together to create thrilling performances and enduring friendships.

Sad as it is to imagine, Kathi and Bruce are leaving Berkeley after 25 and 35 years, respectively. Let's rally around them once again by expressing our appreciation for the joyous memories and valuable lessons they shared with us and help them begin their next great adventure.

This is not a retirement gift, but a fund to help them transition into the next stage of their careers. If, like me, you cannot imagine high school or where you would be today without their influences, let this be a way to thank them.

Sincerely,

Evan Farrior

Class of '05

story:
Yes Equality - Help us Bring Home the Message

Everyone at Yes Equality would like to thank all who have donated to the campaign so far. Your generosity has allowed us to launch the Yes Equality Bus Tour which is making its way across the country, engaging in conversations and spreading the yes message. Our Yes posters have gone up on lampposts all around the country and will hopefully reach as many voters as possible.

Now we need your help to bring the message home. This is the final ask.

We need to raise €50,000 as soon as possible to deliver 1,000,000 booklets to households throughout the country. 

The booklet features stories from people across Ireland on why marriage and family matter. It carries answers to questions voters have so that they can understand the importance and true effect of a Yes vote.

The booklet is going into 1,000,000 homes from now until the day of the Referendum on May 22nd.

How will your donation by used?

Real people and their real stories of why they are voting Yes are the most powerful means of helping voters move to a Yes vote. We have printed 1 million booklets are we are starting to deliver them to homes across Ireland. Many people have already donated to the campaign, we are asking for further funds to make the delivery a reality.
Please donate what you can. We will keep you updated on how exactly your donation is being spent. If you have any questions please contact info@yesequality.ie

Other Ways You Can Help

After you have made your donation there are other ways you can help the campaign:

  • Get 3 others to donate to the campaign
  • Get canvassing! Find more information here.
  • If you would like to get involved with your local Yes Equality group – please check out the website for contact details here.
For more information on the Yes Equality Campaign for Civil Marriage Equality please visit our website here.

*Please note that only Irish citizens can donate to the Yes Equality campaign. All funds go to LGBT Equality Ltd., on behalf of Yes Equality, registered with SIPO.

story:
prologue

LINI CUBE - the most eminent innovation in history of toy building blocks since 1939

There is only one first time.

Be the one to own the very first Lini cube set EVER and find out why we think this will set a new standard in interlocking building blocks!

It’s LIMITED!

Choose your reward. They are all BACKERS ONLY LIMITED EDITION with an exclusive red color (the red you see in the videos and pictures) that will NOT be reproduced EVER AGAIN. This will give you the proof that you’ve been part of the revolution from day one and they might even gain value over time. 

This project was fully funded on Kickstarter. Until everything is ready there will be a limited time to jump on and join the ride. 

All the images are moving pictures. It might take a few minutes until they are loaded.

Thanks 
Daniel







content

1. introducing lini cube 
2. features 
3. educational 
4. design 
5. colors 
6. production 
7. project timeline 
8. press 
9. risks and challenges


1. introducing lini cube

Lini cube is a beautiful educational toy building block that enables you to be more creative than ever before.


2. features

  • variety
    There are 105 different ways you can plug a lini cube into another. It’s more than 11 times compared to a conventional building block. 
  • sideplug
    You can use the sides to build. The conventional building blocks would only allow you to build on top. 
  • upside down
    Build without defining a top, side or bottom. Make a bathtub, turn it around and let it be a table. 
  • moveThe move feature lets you have moving parts within your building. Build a couch that converts into a bed or a fence with gates that open and close. 
  • add
    Add something to the side of a finished building like a stairway, bunk bed or a balcony without having to reassemble it. 
  • 3D puzzleCreate your own stunning 3D puzzles. Watch the demo. 
  • hide
    Build items that complement each other as demonstrated in the features demo video.


3. educational

I had the chance to test the lini cube in three protectories. It was interesting to see how different children approach building. Some would just build in two dimensions even though they have the ability to build in any directions. Some would create awesome spatial buildings right from the start.

This showed me, that the lini cube is not just a great educational toy but also ideal to test or experiment on cognitive abilities like perception, attention, memory, learning, problem solving, creativity, planning, orientation, imagination…


4. design

The design in every aspect had to be perfect. It is not easy to create a construction toy with all those features and still keep it beautiful. Even though there are infinite ways to create a pattern, I designed the pattern very carefully. 

In the acoustics the sinus wave will create a harmonious sound. I tried to transfer this principle to the design of the lini cube. I used sinus curves to make the design feel harmonious. The intersection of horizontal and vertical sinus curves create the beautiful pattern. It looks like little pillows. 

But design is more than just the look. It goes hand in hand with the technical feature. The pockets that are cut half on the edges will have a dovetail. This enables you to plug another cube onto the edge without falling off. Furthermore it’s lets you connect two building blocks with just one plug. 

The pillow pockets have also another important feature. You can plug cylindric shapes and shapes with a square like footprint into the pockets. Cylinders have the ability to rotate and square like footprints are better for alignment and connecting two blocks.

This design approach also creates an extra shifted line with pockets which result in more plugging options. 

Instead of having many single studs on the outside surface I connected them with each other. This prevents the surface from being bumpy and allows another object to slide along. 


5. colors

Colours are wonderful and something I dearly love. The toy industry sometimes gives me the impression to throw random colours at children. I wanted to give it the attention it deserves and came up with a new approach. I can’t wait to share it with you!

Nevertheless before we get to talk about colours we have to kick off production. So in this campaign I want to focus on presenting the features and uniqueness of the product as well as getting production started. 

I can’t work on to many ends at the same time if I want to get it right. So I decided to separate it. If this campaign succeeds we can go a step further. 

Therefor I thought about something special for everyone who supports me in this campaign. You will have the chance on getting a Limited Edition red color that will not be reproduced any time later. It's the red used for demonstration, the one you can see on the pictures and videos. 


6. production

The entire production will be Made in Germany. Prototyping, molds, production, packaging. Probably the most expensive part of this project are the molds. While in most cases this part will be contracted to Chinese companies to save extensive time and money, I decided to do this locally. There are three main reason for this: I don’t want to give construction files out of country. Second, it’s a toy for children and I want to be as close as possible to production. Third, even though it looks like a simple product it has to be produced with high precision and needs complex tooling. 


7. project timeline

  • 2014, April 09 - Idea 
    The idea together with a certain determination was born on a Wednesday night, not knowing that months of hard work would follow. As I stumbled over a conventional building block that night many thoughts crossed my mind. On one hand I though about how awesome this company is and what brilliant idea (only later I learned, that it was initially invented by someone else). On the other hand I remembered my frustration as a child not being able to plug anything to the side. Nevertheless I had confidence a building block with this capability would soon appear. This never happened. At this very moment I knew, that if I don’t do something about it, I will even see my grandchildren play with building blocks from 1939 and struggle with the same limitations. A few minutes later I had a rough idea of how it could work, a few days later a rough 3D sketch of how it could look like.
  • 2014, May - First Prototype 
    First prototype with round plugs. Up to this point no one I dealt with thought it would work including the prototype builders. Now I had the proof and a few impressed faces. 
  • 2014, June - Second Prototype 
    Second prototype with “pillow” plugs. 
  • 2014, September - Third Prototype
    Various colours and better quality
  • 2014, Dezember - Patents Filing
    3 technical patents. Patents are a science in itself. I learned a lot. For the most ideal protection it was not enough to file one patent. 
  • 2015, January - Building Testings
    Had over a hundred prototypes made to test various models in real life conditions. Do to the small quantity of the prototypes I previously could just do simulations on a computer. Now I could make sure that models in my 3D renderings can actually be build. 
  • 2015, August - Sample Mold
    The sample mold was another challenge. The cube came out surprisingly well with still some tweaks to be done.
  • 2015, October - Design Patent 
    10 Designs registered
  • 2015, October - Support
    1st Support from the German Economics Ministry (German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy).
  • 2015, November - Production Mold
    The results from the production molds are great. Read for production. 
  • 2015, November - Support
    2nd Support from the German Economics Ministry (German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy).
  • 2015, December - Kickstarter Launch



8. press

I want you to get independent reviews on this product as soon as possible. So I have a few samples to give out to the press. If you are from the press, a blogger or even have your own youtube channel please contact me. Send me your press card and the medium you report on. If you are a blogger, send me an email from the website you are blogging for. The email address you are sending from should contain the domain of the website you are blogging for. 


Legal Notice / Privacy Policy
Impressum / Datenschutzerklärung

steps that are still to be taken: 
- find the right packaging 
- go through child safety procedures 
- find a reliable fulfilment service

story:
6,000 miles to freedom

Ji Seong-ho dragged himself 6,000 miles on crutches from North Korea to freedom. Today, Seong-ho uses his newly found liberty to help others suffering under Kim Jong-un's dictatorship. Your donation will enable him to rescue refugees and expand radio broadcasts to the isolated North Korean people.

"These are the crutches that I used to drag myself across 6,000 miles. I never lost them. They symbolize that you can achieve anything if you do not give up. With outside information, North Korea is changing. A free North Korea is possible with your help if we pursue it with this kind of determination." - Ji Seong-ho

How far would you go?

The Human Rights Foundation invites you to consider this question as you learn about the inspiring and incredible story of Ji Seong-ho, a disabled North Korean refugee who dragged himself 6,000 miles on crutches to freedom. Today, Seong-ho uses his newly found liberty to help others suffering under North Korea's dictatorship. He broadcasts radio messages from the outside world and rescues refugees and defectors at risk of being sent back to North Korea, where they would be executed or sent to a concentration camp.


An impossible escape

Seong-ho grew up during the devastating North Korean famine of the 1990s, where Kim Jong-il intentionally withheld food from province deemed disloyal to the regime. Millions starved, and bodies littered the streets. In order to survive, Seong-ho was forced to steal coal and sell it on the black market in order to feed his family. While taking coal from a train car one night, he lost consciousness and fell onto the tracks, losing his left hand and foot when the train car ran over him. 

After enduring a grueling amputation with no anesthesia, his family nursed him back to health at their own expense. Even his brother became stunted due to malnutrition. In North Korea, disabled people are routinely treated as sub-human, and Seong-ho became an outcast. Despite the odds, Seong-ho was determined to survive and make a life for himself. One day he decided to escape North Korea, beginning an epic journey where he would drag himself 6,000 miles on wooden crutches through China and the jungles of southeast Asia all the way to Thailand. There, he was finally able to get on to a plane to South Korea.


Seong-ho's mission

Though now living in a free and open society today in Seoul, Seong-ho has never forgotten those he left behind. To assist his friends and family trapped in North Korea's totalitarian state, Seong-ho founded Now Action and Unity for Human Rights (NAUH), an organization that saves refugees and broadcasts radio messages with truth, culture, and knowledge into North Korea. Despite NAUH's limited resources, over the last four years it has helped give freedom to more than 100 North Korean women, children, and disabled people, and has broadcast thousands of hours of radio programming into the country, sending messages of hope to those trapped in the world's largest open-air prison.

Today NAUH operates out of a single-room, 140 square foot, fifth floor walk-up in Seoul with no elevator. It holds Seong-ho's desk and not much else, making it very hard to conduct even routine office business, and making it nearly impossible to accommodate visitors and volunteers. What's more, the daily climb up dozens of stairs has become very painful for Seong-ho, who has developed inflammation on his left leg because of the physical stress on his prosthetic leg. His amputation in North Korea was not done using modern medical standards, and he often needs to visit a hospital for treatment.

Why donate today

This mission is time-sensitive, because on September 17, Seong-ho and NAUH's current lease will expire. Donate now to help HRF move Seong-ho into a handicapped-accessible office that will not bring him physical harm and pain. This will allow him and his staff to maximize their full potential in carrying out their vital educational and rescue efforts. These programs provide information to the North Korean people so they can begin to choose for themselves the kind of world in which they want to live. Please help Seong-ho with the critical task of spreading information to those who need it most.

#HowFarWouldYouGo

Please help us share this initiative with your friends, family, and networks to spread the word. In the photo gallery, you'll see people from Cuba to Malaysia who have posed with crutches above their heads, just like Seong-ho did when he concluded his triumphant speech at the Oslo Freedom Forum. Post a picture of yourself with crutches above your head, along with the #HowFarWouldYouGo hashtag, to help the momentum going with this campaign.

Why is the fundraising goal $51,353?

The most basic necessity in Seong-ho's structure of needs is a home base. His tiny one-room office, with its daunting flight of stairs, is limiting his potential and taking a painful toll on his health. In order to save more lives and send more information into North Korea, Seong-ho needs a bigger and better headquarters. In South Korea's "wolseh" real estate system, a renter signs a lease for 1 or 2 years and makes a security deposit on the space equal to as much as 10% of its market value. Here is a resource for learning more about the South Korean real estate system. Seong-ho hopes to move into a new 1076 square foot office in Woo-il Town, located right in front of a metro station and equipped with two elevators and separate male and female bathrooms. The $51,353 fundraising goal will cover the $44,681 security deposit and first month's rent payment of $2,868 for this space, as well as the fees taken by IndieGoGo and its credit card processors.

Who is HRF?

The Human Rights Foundation is a human rights organization that protects and promotes individual rights around the world where they are most at risk. Since 2009, HRF has partnered with North Koreans who have risked their lives to escape this tyranny that has caused so much suffering. Together, we support the dissemination of information into North Korea by land, air, and radio.

These defector groups are inadequately funded, but passionately devoted to the cause of a free and democratic North Korea. They believe that information and education are the keys to liberating their homeland. HRF's goal is to assist them with the technology, know-how, and funding they need to make a measurable difference in this all-important battle for the freedom of 25 million North Koreans.

HRF is a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit. Learn more about our work at HRF.org. HRF produces the Oslo Freedom Forum, which you can learn more about at oslofreedomforum.com.

Who made the cool video?

Smock Media's mission is to produce authentic films that impact public discussion, protect the creative process of expression, and highlight amazing stories of individual triumph. Smock's founder, Hawk Jensen, is thrilled to volunteer his time and creative talents to help bring Ji Seong-ho's voice to a broader audience of supporters. Seong-ho is the physical embodiment of everything for which Smock stands. We could not be more grateful and honored to help share the story of this incredible human being who has conquered the impossible and continues to save hundreds of lives from tyranny.

Source materials for this video were provided by HRF and NAUH. Additional materials are either under Creative Commons license, in the public domain, or are being used within the confines of Fair Use. The film is for promotional use only. All work on the production was completed on a volunteer basis by: Director and Editor Hawk Jensen; Creative Editor Andy Lee; Associate Producer Heather Muszynski; and Associate Producer Austin Michael. The film features Ji Seong-ho, with narration by Andy Lee and translation by Henry Song. Music is courtesy of "Don't Get Any Closer" by Eluvium, and select North Korea photography has been provided by Damir Sagolj. Special thanks to the Moving Picture Institute and Lana Harfoush. Production is courtesy of Smock Media Holdings LLC - #ALLRIGHTSRESERVED


Where is Seong-ho giving the speech in the video?

Each year HRF organizes the Oslo Freedom Forum in Norway. It's a conference designed to gather amazing people together to make the world a more peaceful, prosperous, and free place. Seong-ho gave a talk there in May, where he received the conference's first standing ovation in three years. Learn more at OsloFreedomForum.com and @OsloFF.

What will I get by donating?

All perks include the ones above

$10 – A thank you note from HRF

$25 – A personalized thank you from Ji Seong-ho

$50 – A handmade Christmas card from a North Korean refugee

$100 – A “Free North Korea With Love” T-shirt

$250 – A signed English-language transcript from Ji Seong-ho’s radio program

$1,000 – A personal video chat with Ji Seong-ho, with a translator on the line

$3,000 – An opportunity to send a custom message into North Korea with Ji Seong-ho’s radio program

$6,000 – An invitation to join HRF on a trip to Korea to meet Ji Seong-ho and the North Korean defector movement

$10,000 – A personal meeting with Ji Seong-ho in the US in November of this year. 

Where will the money go?

100% of all funds donated to HRF for this campaign will be given to Now Action and Unity for Human Rights (NAUH). Full accounting of the funds donated will take place by the conclusion of the 2015 calendar year and will be published along with HRF’s yearly financials. Donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent permissible by law.

How else can I help Seong-ho?

Please share the campaign with your networks by spreading the word about #HowFarWouldYouGo. Follow us at @HRF on Twitter, and visit our website at HRF.org for more information. If you have questions or would like to help in any way, please email info@humanrightsfoundation.org.

6,000 miles to freedomJi
Seong-ho dragged himself 6,000 miles on crutches from North Korea to freedom.
Today, Seong-ho uses his newly found liberty to help others suffering under Kim
Jong-un's dictatorship. Your donation will enable him to rescue refugees
and expand radio broadcasts to the isolated North Korean people.
"These are the crutches that I used to drag myself across 6,000 miles. I never lost them. They symbolize that you can achieve anything if you do not give up. With outside information, North Korea is changing. A free North Korea is possible with your help if we pursue it with this kind of determination." - Ji Seong-hoHow far would you go?The Human Rights Foundation invites you to consider this question as you learn about the inspiring and incredible story of Ji Seong-ho, a disabled North Korean refugee who dragged himself 6,000 miles on crutches to freedom. Today, Seong-ho uses his newly found liberty to help others suffering under North Korea's dictatorship. He broadcasts radio messages from the outside world and rescues refugees and defectors at risk of being sent back to North Korea, where they would be executed or sent to a concentration camp.
An impossible escape
Seong-ho grew up during the devastating North Korean famine of the
1990s, where Kim Jong-il intentionally withheld food from province deemed
disloyal to the regime. Millions starved, and bodies littered the streets. In
order to survive, Seong-ho was forced to steal coal and sell it on the black
market in order to feed his family. While taking coal from a train car one
night, he lost consciousness and fell onto the tracks, losing his left hand and
foot when the train car ran over him. 
After enduring a grueling amputation with no anesthesia, his
family nursed him back to health at their own expense. Even his brother became
stunted due to malnutrition. In North Korea, disabled people are routinely
treated as sub-human, and Seong-ho became an outcast. Despite
the odds, Seong-ho was determined to survive and make a life for himself. One

drag himself 6,000 miles on wooden crutches through China and the jungles of
southeast Asia all the way to Thailand. There, he was finally able to get on to
a plane to South Korea.

open society today in Seoul, Seong-ho has never forgotten those he left
behind. To assist his friends and family trapped in North Korea's totalitarian
state, Seong-ho founded Now Action and Unity for Human Rights (NAUH), an
organization that saves refugees and broadcasts radio messages with truth,

hours of radio programming into the country, sending messages of hope to those
trapped in the world's largest open-air prison.
