story:
Give a Child the Chance to Be Fed, to Grow and to Flourish


Many of the children attending Ramón Rosa Elementary School in Honduras are living in poverty and struggle during school because they cannot afford to eat breakfast or lunch. As a result, we are raising funds to feed the 64 current students of the school healthy meals throughout the summer.

We will be sending 5 interns to the rural community of El Rodeito, Honduras, where the school is located, for 10 weeks this summer. They will be focussing on promoting educational and community development to improve conditions and opportunities.


We Need Your Help!

Our current campaign is part of our ongoing effort to improve conditions in El Rodeito. We are currently working towards building a functional school kitchen for Ramón Rosa, which will allow the school to become self-sustainable in the future and will provide additional incentive for parents to send their children to school.

However, this project requires a lot of support. With your help, we can end hunger for the children at Ramon Rosa Elementary and supply them with the option of a better future.

To complete the project and implement the meal plan, a total of $7,500 needs to be raised, but the initial $800 that we are collecting will enable us to begin  offering meals to ALL the children in El Rodeito this summer! After the kitchen is built we will only need $0.25 per child/day to provide them with  breakfast and lunch while they are at school. 



Meet Our Team Of Summer Interns: 

Krystin Chiellini

Santana Silver 

Jenny Tobat 

Christopher Yoo 

Connor Goldman

About Our Nonprofit

I'm Nancy, the Founder of Mayor Potencial (Greater Potential). I grew up in Honduras, where 60% of the population is living in poverty. Since I left, not much has changed in places like my home town. Our vision is to promote sustainable community development in rural Latin America and empower future leaders to foster social change. 


More About Our Gifts for Donors

Our HIGHEST  DONOR will receive a beautiful hand carved  gift from skilled crafters in Honduras.

A huge thanks to all of our contributors who will help to make an amazing difference for the  64 children at Ramon Rosa Elementary School in Honduras!!

story:
The Heck is Tot Mob?

We're Cheerleaders, Organizers, and Generals for an army of average joe's that want to help, but either don't know how or dont have time. Last year we raised $2300 for Toys for Tots in our area just by asking friends to contribute if they could, or tell a friend if they couldn't. We want to do more!

We want to help more kids, everywhere, and not just during the holidays. Thats why we need your help. We want to establish a peer funding website, much like this one, but for kids. Kids that want to play sports, or play a real instrument in band, or go to summer camp, but financial reasons hold them back. Let's change that.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $5000, I've spent my savings to get us where we are now, and just dont have the last bit to get us the rest of the way.

We need a new computer. It's how we run this thing, and the one we have is on life support. laptop - $299.00 

We need Tax and book keeping software. "Quickbooks for Nonprofits" On sale - $309 at newegg.com

We need funds to pay the guys working on the code. - unknown, still kicking ideas around.

Tot Mob is an Unincorporated Nonprofit Association based in Iowa. Basically Iowa and a few other states developed this model for charities that want to have a sort of trial to see if they need to spend the money on becoming a full fledged 501c3. I'd like to have the money to file our 501c3 just in case this blows up like we hope its going to. $750 + attorney fees

We need a P.O. Box, I'm using my home address for this right now, and not real fond of it. $150/year

Anything left over goes to help set up an endowment with the Community Foundation of the Great River Bend, to make sure that Tot Mob is sustainable, now and in the future.

$150 reward

 

The Impact

We're in contact with a bunch of charity and family organizations to set up a system that makes sure that we're helping kids who actually need it. As someone who lived that life, I can tell you that the gifts made a difference, and all of the suggestions above were things that I personally dealt with. Lets make a difference. Together.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Share this with your friends and family, we've operated on that principle since day 1. Tweet it, share it, like it. All it takes is a couple of clicks to raise awareness of the awesome work we are all about to do.

We need T-shirt designs and have what we've been told is a pretty awesome way of rewarding designers, click here if you're interested in learning more. It's not pro bono, its pro-bonus! (cheesy.)

Check us out on the web or facebook or  twitter, and give us some love if you like what we're doing.

 

 

Just by asking people to help we've accomplished this - Tot Mob's Donorschoose Giving Page and we're getting more donations every day.

WHBF News interviewed me last year when we dropped off the second half of the toys, here.

story:
#30Days of ThanksgivingLO  

You may not know this about me, but I had the AMAZING opportunity to go through a program called Legal Outreach in high school. Legal Outreach works with students from underserved neighborhoods around NYC and prepares them to succeed in high school, college, and beyond.  

I'm fundraising this November to make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach.  

My Story  

My name is Jordan Knox and I grew up in Harlem. I went to Manhattan Business Academy for High School. 

Legal Outreach is the program that help me set a goal for myself and achieve that very goal. I found myself much more prepared to compete academically at Georgetown University than had I not been in the program. Thanks to Legal Outreach I am confident in my ability to be successful during my undergraduate  education and further on to graduate school in the future.

Because of Legal Outreach, I was encouraged to apply to colleges and attended Georgetown University. LO supported me beginning in 8th grade, and I left LO four years later inspired and equipped for college. 

Your support can change the lives of more students like me!

Your Support Will... 

Make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach for four years of free programming, including a debate program, SAT prep, writing classes, mentoring, college application workshops, and much more! 

Of the students LO supports: 

  • 100% graduated HS on time (only 66% of NYC public school students do) 
  • 99% went on to colleges and universities 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Donate to my campaign before December 2nd, 2014 
  • Share my campaign on social media 
  • Encourage your networks to support my campaign 

I'm thankful for LO and I'm thankful for your support!  

#30DaysofThanksgivingLO
www.legaloutreach.org
www.facebook.com/legaloutreach
@legaloutreach

story:
PROJECT SUMMARY

THE LAVENDER EFFECT® is a Southern California nonprofit, formed by members of the LGBTQ and Allied community, to teach and celebrate Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer (LGBTQ) Heritage and Culture. Though our community has made enormous strides over the past half-century, homophobia still exists, and the epidemic of suicides by LGBTQ teens continues. There is an urgent need to demystify the existence of LGBTQ persons, to educate both our own young people and the population-at-large of the enormous impact we have had, and continue to have, on civilization.

To commemorate World AIDS Day, on Monday, December 1, 2014, THE LAVENDER EFFECT® launched a campaign entitled The Oral History Project AIDS Testimonies. Funds raised during the month of December will be used to record video testimonies from LGBTQ and allied citizens who were integral participants in the AIDS/HIV epidemic from the mid 1980s to present day.

WHAT WE NEED & WHO BENEFITS

$15,000 will provide enough funding to research, document, transcribe, edit, and share  over 6-hours of critical testimonials. These will range from AIDS survivors to Pioneering Activists that helped to save lives and change medical history. Hearing these profound personal accounts will educate current and future generations that may not understand the devastation and lasting social impact of AIDS/HIV.

Utilizing guidelines developed by Steven Spielberg's Shoah Holocaust documentation project, these videos will be utilized for educational purposes through classroom presentations, educational workshops, and interactive exhibits.

THE HOLLYWOOD TEAM

The OHP is being researched and produced by an experienced and professional team.  Andy Sacher, Founding Executive and Creative Director, is leading this effort and has worked for leaders in the entertainment industry including Disney, Steven Spielberg, and Jerry Bruckheimer. Team Lavender is partnering with Evolution Media, LGBTQ historians, and community advisors to interview people that shaped the life and freedom LGBTQ people enjoy today. Digital testimonies will be utilized for educational programs and interactive exhibits. They will also be available to Archives, Libraries, Researchers and Filmmakers with the goal of reaching the broadest audience possible.

THE CAMPAIGN VIDEO

THE LAVENDER EFFECT® assembled a notable group of AIDS/HIV survivors and advocates to appear in this Indiegogo campaign including; early AIDS activist and actress Alison Arngrim (Little House on the Prairie’s Nellie Oleson) who became one of the most visible AIDS advocates in Hollywood when her beloved Television husband, actor Steve Tracy, was diagnosed with AIDS in 1984; Robert Schoonover, former Director of the AIDS Hotline in Los Angeles from 1984 - 1993; longtime survivor/advocate Steve Pieters, former Metropolitan Community Church AIDS Ministry Global Field Director; and survivor/advocate Jack Inman, emotional support facilitator for the Life Group, Los Angeles. The OHP AIDS Testimonies Campaign Video was Produced by Consulting Advisor David Sperber, shot by Rachel Dunn,and Edited by James Roman.

With your help these heroes are just a small sample of the testimonies this project is planning to document. Others include Noel Alumit, Tony Arn, Sunnie Rose Berger, John D'Amico, Max Drew, John Duran, Lady Gaga, Dean Goishi, Dr. Michael S. Gottlieb, Sir Elton John, Magic Johnson, Ashley Judd, Michael Kearns, Alicia Keys, Annie Lennox, Sherri Lewis, Tim Miller, Ervin Munro, Dale Raoul, Matt Redman, Nancy Cole Saways, Nadia Sutton, Jewel Thais-Williams, Craig Thompson, Michael Weinstein, Phill Wilson, Richard Zaldivar, and many more. Please send your suggestions to David.Sperber@TheLavenderEffect.org

PROMOTIONAL SPONSORS

   

Being Alive LA                     AIDS Service Center

story:
Short Summary

We are a diverse group of kids from different backgrounds in Southern Maryland that have a dream to compete in the 13th International Submarine Races (ISR) scheduled for June 2015 at the Carderock Naval Surface Warfare Center in Bethesda, MD.  Our ages range from 8-18 and our group will be the youngest participants this year!  We will be competing against college and high school engineering programs from around the world in this super-specialized category of man-powered underwater vehicles. 

(2015 team members with signs indicating the part of the sub that they are working on - hull, buoyancy, propulsion and steering)


Two years ago a group from the Accokeek summer swim team in Prince George’s County Maryland decided to build a man sized submarine to compete in the ISR race. They were the youngest group to compete and not only were they able to build a submarine that completed the race; they won the “Best Spirit of the Races Award.” Due to their success, they have inspired another group of young people from the swim team to form a new sub team  --“Nautilus” -- and build a sub to compete in this year’s race.
(here's our team learning about buoyancy by testing their remote control "SeaPerch" model sub)

Our goal is:

To design and build a one man, non-propeller, wet submarine that will go faster than 1.32kts., cross the finish line and attempt to manufacture as many of the components ourselves.

(team members testing different materials for the hull)


We have put in evening and weekend hours, a lot of energy, and sacrifice to get to this point. Our team has researched the physics of submarines in order to decide which design to pursue. Working with mentors,we have taken apart an old jet ski to learn about propulsion, built a “SeaPerch” model remotely-controlled submarine to learn about buoyancy and steering and met with a ship builder to learn about how to build a hull.  Our subgroups are designing a strong hull, drive train, buoyancy-control system, steering system, and life support and emergency systems.  We’re also building a custom cart to move the submarine around on the ground and planning all the logistics of race week.

(this is how we spend our Friday evenings! meeting and working on our sub design)


By participating in this stretch STEM project-based activity that most people don’t expect this age group to do, we are getting excited about science and we are getting the confidence to tackle just about anything else!

(here we are taking apart a jet-ski to learn about propulsion)


What We Need

Although we have received generous donations of various supplies, we are still in need of $15,000 to cover the costs of:

1.  Submarine materials: fiberglass, acrylic, epoxy, metal and hardware, electronics for buoyancy control, welding materials, emergency systems, etc.

2.  Scuba diving certifications for children pilots and adult support team

3.  Scuba diving equipment rental

4.  Transportation to and from competition site

5.  Competition registration fees 

With your donations we’ll be able to engineer and build our sub and compete in June.  In the process we hope to be an inspiration to other kids who don’t think science can be fun. 

(we started in the summer at the pool- here we are testing our remote control sub)


Who we are

KIDS is a 501c3 non-profit organization whose mission is enrichment education for children in the field of science, engineering, technology, mathematics and program management through hands on design and fabrication experience while aiming to solve real world challenges. (our  website is: http://kidsintodiscoveringscience.weebly.com/)  KIDS is raising money to participate in the Foundation for Underwater Research and Education’s (FURE) International Submarine Races (ISR), a biennial engineering design competition, at NSWC Carderock Division in West Bethesda, Md. Teams wear scuba gear and compete in one- and two-person “wet” submarines designed to run submerged along a 100-meter course in the US Navy’s David Taylor Model Basin.
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are a
diverse group of kids from different backgrounds in Southern Maryland that
have a dream to compete in the 13th International Submarine Races
(ISR) scheduled for June 2015 at the Carderock Naval Surface Warfare Center in
Bethesda, MD.  Our ages range from 8-18 and our group will be the youngest
participants this year!  We will be competing against college and high
school engineering programs from around the world in this super-specialized
category of man-powered underwater vehicles. (2015 team members with signs indicating the part of the sub that they are working on - hull, buoyancy, propulsion and steering)Two years ago a group from the Accokeek summer swim team in Prince George’s County Maryland decided to build a man sized submarine to compete in the ISR race. They were the youngest group to compete and not only were they able to build a submarine that completed the race; they won the “Best Spirit of the Races Award.” Due to their success, they have inspired another group of young people from the swim team to form a new sub team  --“Nautilus” -- and build a sub to compete in this year’s race.(here's our team learning about buoyancy by testing their remote control "SeaPerch" model sub)Our goal
is:
To
design and build a one man, non-propeller, wet submarine that will go faster
than 1.32kts., cross the finish line and attempt to manufacture as many of the
components ourselves. (team members testing different materials for the hull)We
have put in evening and weekend hours, a lot of energy, and sacrifice to
get to this point. Our team has researched the physics of
submarines in order to decide which design to pursue. Working with mentors,we
have taken apart an old jet ski to learn about propulsion, built a “SeaPerch”
model remotely-controlled submarine to learn about buoyancy and steering and met
with a ship builder to learn about how to build a hull.  Our subgroups are designing a strong hull, drive
train, buoyancy-control system, steering system, and life support and emergency
systems.  We’re also building a custom
cart to move the submarine around on the ground and planning all the logistics
of race week.(this is how we spend our Friday evenings! meeting and working on our sub design)
By
participating in this stretch STEM project-based activity that most people don’t
expect this age group to do, we are getting excited about science and we are getting the confidence to tackle just about anything else! (here we are taking apart a jet-ski to learn about propulsion)
What We Need 
Although
we have received generous donations of various supplies, we are still in need
of $15,000 to cover the costs of: 
1. 
Submarine
materials: fiberglass, acrylic, epoxy, metal and hardware, electronics for
buoyancy control, welding materials, emergency systems, etc.
2. 
Scuba
diving certifications for children pilots and adult support team 
3. 
Scuba
diving equipment rental 
4. 
Transportation
to and from competition site
5. 
Competition
registration fees  
With
your donations we’ll be able to engineer and build our sub and compete in June.
 In the process we hope to be an
inspiration to other kids who don’t think science can be fun. (we started in the summer at the pool- here we are testing our remote control sub)
Who we are
KIDS is a 501c3 non-profit organization whose mission is enrichment
education for children in the field of science, engineering, technology,
mathematics and program management through hands on design and fabrication
experience while aiming to solve real world challenges. (our  website is: http://kidsintodiscoveringscience.weebly.com/)  KIDS is raising money
to participate in the Foundation for Underwater Research and Education’s (FURE)
International Submarine Races (ISR), a biennial engineering design competition,
at NSWC Carderock Division in West Bethesda, Md. Teams wear scuba gear and compete
in one- and two-person “wet” submarines designed to run submerged along a
100-meter course in the US Navy’s David Taylor Model Basin.

story: We are a group of six students from the Montessori High School, looking to pursue a study in athletics, specifically rock climbing. Every year our school has a two week, intensive, student led study of our choice where we are able to choose what area of study we'd like to research. In order to continue our interest in rock climbing, we plan to travel to Pennsylvania where we will be able to do outdoor rock climbing, camping, hiking, as well as learning about basic outdoor survival skills. With your support we will be able to attain our goal. Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

Whitney has the incredible opportunity to perform in the nation's cultural epicenter- New York City- and needs your help to get there! The trip costs $1300 (Yikes!), and she's working hard to fundraise the money. 

The Impact

This is a trip of a lifetime! Not only will Whitney be able to experience NYC for the first time and have the unique opportunity to perform there (every musician's dream), she will also have several one-on-one conducting lessons with notable conductors in the city, an opportunity unique only to her! This is sure to help her jump-start her future career as an orchestra conductor!


How You Can Help

If you're in a position to contribute funds, please do! You can donate in any increment you'd like, and EVERY contribution helps and is very appreciated!

If donating is not an option for you, you can still help by spreading the word! Help make some noise so that as many people will help as possible!

Thank you! You're helping shape a future!

story:
My Story

"Whether you think that you can, or that you can't, you are usually right." ~Henry Ford


Hello! You've learned a few details about me, and below are a few more not covered in the video:

For the past decade, part of my work has involved telling the stories of local communities and people as a journalist. The feedback I've received has been very humbling, and it's great to know so many readers enjoy my work. Still, the shift in the industry meant I needed to change my strategy. It led me to refocus beyond journalism into helping companies and organizations tell their stories directly to the public. With the new skills and knowledge I am acquiring through MCDM, I can be even more effective in doing that.

My first quarter back in school has already stretched me in exciting ways. I am approaching a few local nonprofits to create three-minute videos for them pro bono, so I can expand my multimedia production skills while helping them showcase their work. If this is the result of merely one quarter, imagine the results of the entire program!


Why I'm Here

After I lost my newspaper contract and my plan to self-finance my program fell through, I began looking at other possibilities such as grants, scholarships and fellowships offered at UW. Finding opportunities in the middle of a school year is very challenging, so I am working on applications for next year. In the meantime, I decided to try the idea of a self-created scholarship fund via sponsorships where I can give something in return. I hope to attract those who can use my skills and experience in exchange for their support, but also welcome any inspirational contributions that have no offered "perks."


What I Need & What You Get

The total goal of $9,000 will pay for three half-time quarters (one class per quarter, bringing me up to 20 credits out of the 45 required for the degree). In the event I exceed my goal, I will enroll full-time instead during the winter quarter. All the money raised will go to tuition, so any amount helps. Next quarter begins on Jan. 4 so I do have a bit of a time crunch for the first one-third of the goal.


The Fine Print

Since the total amount covers tuition for the rest of the academic year, the "perks" that involve services can be claimed any time over that same time period after the campaign ends (but let me know if your need is more urgent). Please contact me if any of the terms are not clear or you would like to pitch me an alternative perk, I'm open to ideas!

GIVE A PLEDGE!

If you'd like to do a sponsorship but are not able to do it before the end of the campaign, contact me with your pledge. This amount will not be reflected here but I will keep my supporters posted via an update.

Information About Me

  • -my website (www.rodikat.com)
  • -my LinkedIn profile
  • -my grad school blog, "journalist in retraining"
  • -Twitter
  • -Facebook
  • -Sandwiched In, my personal blog about being part of the sandwich generation

Special Thanks

Thank you to DoÃ±a Keating of Professional Options, Charles Keating of Keating Consulting Service, Inc, Frank J. Kenny, WestSound Home & Garden Magazine, Popcorn Chef and Amy's Decadent Chocolates for your support of this effort. Also special thanks to MCDM for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! If you know a company that may be interested in sponsorships or have friends who like to support educational goals, please send this page to them. And if you stumbled onto this campaign on your own or are looking for other worthy causes, please peruse indiegogo.com for other ideas; I appreciate you considering me!

story:
What's Going On

Hello friends!

I have a been a student at Biola University for the past year, and I am currently preparing for my senior year.

Unfortunately, I find myself a little short on money for school this year for a variety of reasons...

  • My school costs about $38,000 per year to attend (including room and board).
  • I've tapped out all of my financial aid (loans, grants, scholarships, etc).
  • My family is not in a financial position to help.
  • A bizarre series of events this summer has left me unable to work and pay for this myself.

How You Can Help

  1. I need prayer support. I believe in a mighty, sovereign God that has a plan and doesn't make mistakes. More than anything, I'm asking for your continued prayer as I try to raise enough money to pursue my education in Psychology.
  2. After prayerful consideration, if you are at all able, I am asking for any kind of financial aid that you may be able to provide. There is no amount that is too great or too small... quite literally, EVERY little bit helps.
  3. If you can, please share my link and my story to anyone and everyone you know who may be able to help!

The Kicker

I have a little over one week to raise enough money to secure my spot at Biola for the Fall 2012 semester.

As you can imagine, this whole situation is just a little bit stressful, so I am turning to you, whoever you may be, for help. As I stated above, I believe God has a plan through all of this, and I believe that you may be a part of the solution. Would you consider helping me?

Thank you all in advance for your help and in partnering with me to continue my education and my future!

story:
Hello Loved Ones!


I’ve been gently growing my creative practice over the years, serving healers, musicians, changemakers, therapists, visionary startups, coaches, my Americorps team, friends and family. This work comes straight from my heart and I’m now ready to take my creative practice, Wild Cloud Creative, to the next level in order to better serve all the community members with my creative services. I’ve enrolled in Ryan Eliason’s Visionary Business course to bring even more entrepreneurship skill, empowerment, and contribution to this sweet intersection between what the world needs and what I love. Visit be.net/jessilyn to see what I’ve been up to at Wild Cloud Creative.
I’m now raising $1,000 by March 31st to fund this course and move forward on this path of service with grace and support.


Will you donate $15, $30 or $50 to help my take my business skills to the next level so I can live my creative passion?


By donating, you’ll receive a handmade creation from me!

Check out the offerings below.


Thank you for taking the time to read through this. I appreciate the myriad forms of support I receive from you all.

Much Love and excitement,

Jessilyn


Here’s how we’ll work together!


With a $15 donation I’ll create

A 2”x4” illustration for you.


With a $30 donation, I’ll create

A 5”x7” original drawing that I create just for you.




With a $50+ I’ll create

A 9”x12” original drawing. You choose the theme and I create a mini mural just for you.


Thanks and Love everyone,

Jessilyn

story:
Short Summary

Hi. We're Cheng and Niels, two high school exchange students in Southern Oregon. Niels is from a small village in Bavaria; Cheng is from one of the biggest metro centers in Southern China. We have been in the US since September, and had a lot of fun so far. We’re hoping to see more of America, and want to go to San Francisco for Spring Break. Our host family is great, but with 2 exchange students, they need your help to get us there.

What We Need & What You Get

We will be traveling with our host mother and host brother from Southern Oregon. We need to raise almost $3,000 to cover the cost of car rental, hostel, parking, food, gas, CityPass, museum fees...  In exchange, we're offering treats and souvenirs (see which level you want at the right). Your contribution will help us learn more about America! Thank you!

  • If we get more funds than needed for this trip, we get to go for a long weekend on the Oregon Coast!

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you in San Francisco? Would you like to meet up with us and show us YOUR city?

  • April 2 - April 6: 4 full days of play and sightseeing in San Francisco

story:
After almost a year, there is little or nothing done for the people of Palestine, despite all the promises.
The children are the majority of the victims, many have lost a parent or both.
These children also have the right to a normal and decent life, but for many this is a dream because if you have no shelter or no clothing, food then it remains a dream.


They see their future and dreams with lots of bright colors.
Give them the chance to make their dreams come true!...


PLEASE HELP THE CHILDREN _ PEOPLE OF PALESTINE!

“” HOPE FOR CHILDREN AND ORPHANS PALESTINE ””
Arabic "اﻻمل لايتام فلسطين"


We want to achieve more, children's / orphans home, shelter, food, clothing, education so that their dream come true.

Thank you on behalf of the people of Palestine
Every donation even 1$ can make a beautiful smile

story:
Join Us!

Our amazing yoga teacher, Caren Lisondra, is preparing for an educational trip of a lifetime.  She will be attending a spiritual school in Chennai, India, to learn how to grow into a more awakened state so that she can guide her students to a new level.

Her journey includes an 11 day residential program where she will participate in various workshops and rituals such as meditations, chanting, processes, and service.  Her flight leaves on November 6th and she will return to the states on November 22nd.

What She Needs

To date she has raised/saved $900 towards this trip.  She needs $2,200 more to cover the rest of her expenses for lodging, registration fee, and transportation. 

The Impact You Will Make

By contributing to this campaign, you are helping Caren to realize one of her dreams -- one that will benefit all of her students in what she brings back in terms of new teachings, stories, practices, and enlightenment. 

Caren's journey to her realization that she should go to Chennai is inspiring.  Many of you have heard her stories of the scrolls.  Please join us in helping her to achieve her goal and get her scroll!

Even if you cannot make a contribution, please get the word out about Caren's journey and make some noise about the campaign. 

Thank you for participating and showing how a caring community can help support a cherished leader to achieve her dreams.

story:
The Opportunity to Synchronize...

SYNTHESIS 2012 is a once-in-a-lifetime global grassroots event occurring in Chichén Itzá and Piste Pueblo in the Yucatán, Mexico from December 20-23, 2012. Chichén Itzá, renown as one of the "New Seven Wonders of the World" (declared in 2007), is visited by an estimated 1.2 million tourists annually. This ancient temple site is an epicentre for Mayan cosmology, and will be a key location due to the synchronous alignment of the El Castillo step pyramid (also known as the Temple of Kukulkan/Quetzalcoatl), our sun, and entire solar system with the center of the Milky Way galaxy (Hunab Ku). Occurring at 5:11am (11:11am UTC) on Winter Solstice, December 21, 2012, this grand alignment coincides with the completion of the Mayan 13-Baktun Great Cycle of 5,125 years. 

The UNESCO-recognized International Mayan Council has been guided to collaborate with Synthesis 2012 as the platform through which they will share their "Message of Synchronization" at this most meaningful time. The council will be joined by many other elders, including don Miguel Ruiz (author of "The Four Agreements"), Hunbatz Men, Maestro Mazatzin, and several luminary speakers, whose wisdom and insight will bring clarity and inspiration for the world as we arrive to this threshold moment. 

Recognizing that many people are unable to attend Synthesis 2012 in person, it is important to the producers to make certain that this phenomenal event, with its wonderful line-up of wisdom keepers, keynote speakers, musical performers, and artistic visionaries, is shared with people around the world using the most up-to-date technology available. With the magnitude of December 21, 2012 drawing the attention of millions of people, we are committed to providing a unique window into this momentous occasion for viewers worldwide, while simultaneously creating a multimedia content archive for many generations to come.

 

From History to Our Story...

Though much has been written, professed, and misinterpreted about the 'end' of the Mayan calendar, the Mayan elders maintain that the completion of the cycle is signaling a great shift in consciousness, moving from separation to unity. The galactic alignment represents a 'rebirth' for humanity and planet Earth as we cross the galactic equator, the dark rift of the Milky Way, seen by the ancient ones as the birth canal of the Great Mother. Inspired by this awareness, Synthesis 2012 has launched our campaign to raise the financial support to professionally live broadcast this unprecedented ceremony and celebration from Piste, Yucatán, and simulcast/stream several other related sacred gatherings, festivals, celebrations and synchronized meditations occurring worldwide from December 21-23, 2012.

Your generous contribution will help us realize our goal of sharing this momentous occasion with viewers planet-wide, and ensuring that the Mayan message, and several other related messages from world-renown wisdom keepers and contemporary luminaries, will be professionally broadcasted and archived for generations to come.

 

Your Support Helps Us Fulfilll The Mission...

In order to produce a professional live broadcast of this historical event occurring in Piste, Yucatán, we require:
  • a well-equipped video crew with HD equipment, creative director, and production support team to record live content and coordinate the 3-day multi-camera broadcast (including airfare and ground transportation for production crew - approximately $14,000.00);
  • a high-bandwidth throughput of the audio/visual signal (content) from the ground to a sateliite for distribution to several online platforms, with a technician specializing in satellite technology (approximately $6,000.00);
  • a pre-production crew that will develop the script, narrative, and production flow of the broadcast, supplemental media, and coordinated streams from participating events worldwide (approximately $1,200.00);
  • a license to utilize a specific state-of-the-art broadcast distribution platform designed for iPhones, iPads, and Androids (65% of the global population receives their media and entertainment via hand-held devices) that additionally provides access to over 1 million college students ($4,000.00);
  • continuous updating, content management, and technical website development support and maintenance for www.WorldUnity2012.com, the main website that Synthesis 2012, along with other global events, will broadcast and stream from, according to a rolling and synchronized schedule during the dates of December 21-23, 2012 (approximately $7,000.00)
For this professional production, as described above, we aim to raise $26,000.00. Some monies have already been raised; and, $26,000.00 is the additional amount we seek to raise to ensure the highest level of broadcast possible.

We are pleased to offer some unique and exciting perks to our supporters. These include posters, books, t-shirts, official Synthesis 2012 passes, visionary art, music and more!

In the event we do not reach our targeted goal of $26,000.00, we will still utilize every penny of your support raised to offset the cost of producing this one-of-a-kind broadcast. We are hoping to offer the world a high level of quality commensurate to what this broadcast, and this magnificent moment in time, deserves. On December 21, 2012, We Go LIVE!!!

Other Ways You Can Help...

Some people are unable to help financially, yet they still want to help us achieve the goal of reaching people worldwide with this synchronized broadcast from Mexico and other locations around the world:

  • Please help us get the word out about Synthesis 2012, and the live broadcast-social media portal: www.WorldUnity2012.com
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo 'share' tools to connect our campaign to your Facebook pages and Twitter feeds. Your word-of-mouth will make a huge difference!

 

Thank you for your support!!
story_txt:
The Opportunity to Synchronize...

SYNTHESIS 2012 is a once-in-a-lifetime global grassroots event occurring in Chichén Itzá and Piste Pueblo in the Yucatán, Mexico from December 20-23, 2012. Chichén Itzá, renown as one of the "New Seven Wonders of the World" (declared in 2007), is visited by an estimated 1.2 million tourists annually. This ancient temple site is an epicentre for Mayan cosmology, and will be a key location due to the synchronous alignment of the El Castillo step pyramid (also known as the Temple of Kukulkan/Quetzalcoatl), our sun, and entire solar system with the center of the Milky Way galaxy (Hunab Ku). Occurring at 5:11am (11:11am UTC) on Winter Solstice, December 21, 2012, this grand alignment coincides with the completion of the Mayan 13-Baktun Great Cycle of 5,125 years. 
The UNESCO-recognized International Mayan Council has been guided to collaborate with Synthesis 2012 as the platform through which they will share their "Message of Synchronization" at this most meaningful time. The council will be joined by many other elders, including don Miguel Ruiz (author of "The Four Agreements"), Hunbatz Men, Maestro Mazatzin, and several luminary speakers, whose wisdom and insight will bring clarity and inspiration for the world as we arrive to this threshold moment. 
Recognizing that many people are unable to attend Synthesis 2012 in person, it is important to the producers to make certain that this phenomenal event, with its wonderful line-up of wisdom keepers, keynote speakers, musical performers, and artistic visionaries, is shared with people around the world using the most up-to-date technology available. With the magnitude of December 21, 2012 drawing the attention of millions of people, we are committed to providing a unique window into this momentous occasion for viewers worldwide, while simultaneously creating a multimedia content archive for many generations to come.
 
From History to Our Story...
Though much has been written, professed, and misinterpreted about the 'end' of the Mayan calendar, the Mayan elders maintain that the completion of the cycle is signaling a great shift in consciousness, moving from separation to unity. The galactic alignment represents a 'rebirth' for humanity and planet Earth as we cross the galactic equator, the dark rift of the Milky Way, seen by the ancient ones as the birth canal of the Great Mother. Inspired by this awareness, Synthesis 2012 has launched our campaign to raise the financial support to professionally live broadcast this unprecedented ceremony and celebration from Piste, Yucatán, and simulcast/stream several other related sacred gatherings, festivals, celebrations and synchronized meditations occurring worldwide from December 21-23, 2012. Your generous contribution will help us realize our goal of sharing this momentous occasion with viewers planet-wide, and ensuring that the Mayan message, and several other related messages from world-renown wisdom keepers and contemporary luminaries, will be professionally broadcasted and archived for generations to come.
 
Your Support Helps Us Fulfilll The Mission...
In order to produce a professional live broadcast of this historical event occurring in Piste, Yucatán, we require:


a well-equipped video crew with HD equipment, creative director, and production support team to record live content and coordinate the 3-day multi-camera broadcast (including airfare and ground transportation for production crew - approximately $14,000.00);
a high-bandwidth throughput of the audio/visual signal (content) from the ground to a sateliite for distribution to several online platforms, with a technician specializing in satellite technology (approximately $6,000.00);
a pre-production crew that will develop the script, narrative, and production flow of the broadcast, supplemental media, and coordinated streams from participating events worldwide (approximately $1,200.00);
a license to utilize a specific state-of-the-art broadcast distribution platform designed for iPhones, iPads, and Androids (65% of the global population receives their media and entertainment via hand-held devices) that additionally provides access to over 1 million college students ($4,000.00);
continuous updating, content management, and technical website development support and maintenance for www.WorldUnity2012.com, the main website that Synthesis 2012, along with other global events, will broadcast and stream from, according to a rolling and synchronized schedule during the dates of December 21-23, 2012 (approximately $7,000.00)

For this professional production, as described above, we aim to raise $26,000.00. Some monies have already been raised; and, $26,000.00 is the additional amount we seek to raise to ensure the highest level of broadcast possible.

We are pleased to offer some unique and exciting perks to our supporters. These include posters, books, t-shirts, official Synthesis 2012 passes, visionary art, music and more!
In the event we do not reach our targeted goal of $26,000.00, we will still utilize every penny of your support raised to offset the cost of producing this one-of-a-kind broadcast. We are hoping to offer the world a high level of quality commensurate to what this broadcast, and this magnificent moment in time, deserves. On December 21, 2012, We Go LIVE!!!
Other Ways You Can Help...
Some people are unable to help financially, yet they still want to help us achieve the goal of reaching people worldwide with this synchronized broadcast from Mexico and other locations around the world:

Please help us get the word out about Synthesis 2012, and the live broadcast-social media portal: www.WorldUnity2012.com

Be sure to use the Indiegogo 'share' tools to connect our campaign to your Facebook pages and Twitter feeds. Your word-of-mouth will make a huge difference!
 

Thank you for your support!!

story:
It's 50 years since Martin Luther King's "I Have a Dream" speech at the March on Washington, in August 1963. I recently turned 50 (51 now) and wanted to do something as a tribute to the spirit of his rare, inspiring and uplifting life.  I am planning to cycle across the USA, from the West Coast to the East as a gesture of appreciation for the life of Martin Luther King, and hope for the future.  Donations to support this sentiment will go to the "I Have a Dream" foundation, which assists kids who need assistance to reach for big dreams, children in need of financial support for higher education goals.  See www.ihaveadreamfoundation.org

Previously I have successfully raised nearly $1000 to help build a school for kids in Guatemala see www.integralheartfoundation.org.  It would be really great to have your support for this project also.  Thankyou.

Kind regards, Joanna Abernethy

story:
The Uganda Society

The Uganda Society is a membership based organization in Uganda's capital Kampala. Founded in 1923 it's the oldest library in the country and offers a wide variety of books from colonial times up to present.

My name is Wartson and i voluntarily work at this library since 2013 as the only person being there during opening hours. The stock includes lots of rare and helpfull books on natural history, ethnography, travels (of missionaries and explorers) and other topics. It's the biggest collection of this kind of books in the country, since most others (including Makerere University) have been destroyed during civil war times. Since there is a lack of resources the books can't be kept under proper conditions and start to slowly falling apart. That is why we need r to digitize the books and save the knowledge for future generations. With an air conditioner it would be possible to save the books and their smell from our tropical climate.


The project

To digitize the books we need, of course, a scanner. We are right now interested in to the piQx Xcanex Portable Book and Document Scanner, which goes for around 300$ abroad, taxes and shipping will be added. But to use the scanner, we also need a computer first. This will also give us the chance to create a online catalogue for researchers to make it easier for people to find the treassures we keep here. We calculate around 550$ for that. The air conditioner goes for around 350$ and would rescue the books which are currently under critical conditions. To repair those, which are not so healthy anymore we plan to spend around 500$ for repairing works and new binding. With a photocopier our visitors could copy from the library and don't need to take the old books to the nearest copyshop. A new one goes for around 300$ in Uganda.

So with an amount of 2000$ we could save our books and preserve Uganda's historical, cultural and scientific diversity. If we cannot achieve this goal, we will start with the scanning before it is to late.


Background of the project

The Uganda Society library houses most of the rare books that can't be found anywhere else in the region. Talking about rare books, we have books written by the early explorers like Livingstone and Stanley in first editions. In auctions worldwide they achieve high prices, but we keep these books to keep the books and knowledge in our country, accessible for the Ugandan People.

Unfortunatly, this great archieve remains in poor state without any of the materials needed for the operation of the library. The society exists for almost 100 years in the way it is, it's time to bring it on a 21st century level.


Become a member!

Other than just donations, you can become a member of the Uganda Society. The membership is open to anybody from any country interested in Uganda's cultural diversity. We currently have around 5600 members worldwide. The society has an organ: "The Uganda Journal" puplishes multidisciplinary articles to its readers. It remains one of the most read journals in Uganda and has a worldwide reputation. Members of the society get a copy once it is published.

story:
The money raised will allow us to fund a professional musician to work with our son, immersing him in music and rhythms from around the world, and also using dynamic movement to stimulate his body and mind. Every session ends with him buzzing with energy and wanting more!

Our son has massive developmental delay in many areas and benefits greatly from intensive sensory and experiential sessions. Our goal is to raise enough funds to be able to continue these inspirational sessions for another 6 months.

story:
Tikslas

Ką gali valia, mokslas ir technologijos? Šiuo metu 868 milijonai žmonių stokoja maisto. Ar galime visiems iškepti duonos? Kaip mes tobulėjame? Ar robotai iš mūsų atims darbo vietas? O gal išlaisvins nuo sunkaus darbo ir galėsime daryti ką norėsime? Mums įdomu, kaip sukurti šviesesnį pasaulį! Ieškome atsakymų ir mąstome. Siekiame šviesti!

Mūsų vizija - tapti žinomiausia ir žiūrimiausia mokslo populiarinimo laida Lietuvoje! Skatinti visuomenės tobulėjimą!

Kurkime Mokslo sriubą kartu!


Kam reikia paramos?

1. Darbo užmokesčiui (minimalus atlyginimas bent 1 žmogui)

2. Naujam galingam kompiuteriui, kad galėtume sklandžiai montuoti laidas

Koks šiuo metu yra Mokslo sriubos biužetas?

3000 eurų skyrė pagrindinis rėmėjas „Bayer“! Apie 6000 Lt. VMI pervedė 2% paramos. Ačiū! Šiuo metu įgyvendiname ES Veiklaus jaunimo projektą apie LT mokslininkus. Projektas finansuoja įrangos nuomą, patalpas, maistą ir transportą. Parašėme paraiškas Spaudos, radijo ir televizijos rėmimo fondui ir Lietuvos mokslų akademijai. Netrukus paaiškės rezultatai.


Mokslo sriubą kuria savanoriai. Kam tiek pinigų?

Šiuo metu mūsų komandą sudaro beveik 25 moksleiviai, studentai, mokslininkai ir specialistai. Kai kurie siejame savo gyvenimą su Mokslo sriuba! Siekiame susikurti darbo vietas ir kryptingai dirbti šioje srityje.

Jei TAU patinka tai ką darome, būk Mokslo sriubos generaliniu rėmėju!

Duomenys:

Baltijos pažangių technologijų institutas
Įmonės kodas: 301846141
Sąskaita: LT587044060007835393
AB SEB bankas

Mokėjimo paskirtyje parašyk: Parama Mokslo sriubai ir savo el. paštą, kad galėtume susirašyti :)

Arba per PayPal sistemą: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=W2VMXE3CQU5PL


Dirbi paslaugų srityje? Kažką gamini? Prisidėk prie Mokslo sriubos savo paslaugomis, produktais, idėjomis!

Taip pat, kviečiame prisijungti prie mūsų komandos ir kurti Mokslo sriubą kartu! Esam atvira iniciatyva, darbų iki ausų, parašyk mums http://mokslosriuba.lt/kartumesgalime/?page_id=8

Kartu mes galime daugiau!

- - -

DOVANOS

Savanorių kūrybos plakatai!

     

Puodeliai!

Mokslo sriubos marškinėliai!

Kurkime Mokslo sriubą kartu!

story:
In a bit more then 2 weeks I will turn 32 years old. This year, I wish only one thing: that everybody has the luck and happiness that I have since I am born. This is why I believe that every children on this planet should be loved and have a life with happiness without missing food, water, education, house etc. In our spoiled countries, it is hard to imagine that some kids are born in poverty. 

My idea...

If I was in Quebec, or even here in Germany, I would organize a party, we would go to a restaurant, spend 25-35$. You would probably buy me flowers or wine (another 10-15$ - Yes in Quebec we pay that for a bottle of wine). This year I want to celebrate my birthday differently. I have nothing to wish for. I am healthy, in peace, in love and I have a wonderful family and amazing friends. 

What I propose to you, my dear friend, is to do a donation. A simple 5$ can make the difference, because we do it all together. If you want to give me this for my birthday, I will split the money in 2 amazing projects, that I cherish with all  my heart. 

Ahsante sana, started 2 years ago when my boyfriend Markus and Kerstin, Dreamed of helping kids in Africa. They sponsor now 50 kids, allowing them to continue their education and go to boarding school. They also raised money to buy arm prosthesis to Ramadan and they installed a water purifying pump. Even if the website isn't yet in English, the pictures are worth 1000 words.

Eco Project Carpe Diem is a really new project founded by my friend Ghislain. He starts an eco lodge in Nicaragua to give back to the community. "The Carpe Diem Eco Project is a humanitarian eco-tourism project. The goal is to empower the local people of Nicaragua by utilizing its tremendous tourism potential, while minimizing environmental impact." 

I will organize with both of them a special project that focus on kids. I will also share with you the results of this donation.

story:
This is Play Communs

To stimulate imagination and creativity, the robots have been designed to be modified, improved and reinvented by children.

The robots are cultural tools for developing awareness independent of any ideology. They define a story where each item is transformed into the protagonist of the play and contemporary drama, and looks towards a possible future. The idea is to redevelop a society based on the community and the sharing of social customs and practises.



This is the kit 

contains

  •  the body of the robot in clear Plexiglas
  •  4 led lights
  • a servo motor
  • an electric transformer
  • preset card
  • a cardboard model
  • assembly instructions and suggestions on how to personalize a character



Accessorizing and sharing

Look at the photo gallery at the top of the page ! 


  • Take a picture of your robot design and post it on www.ultra-ordinaire.com others might like it!
  • Share your design with others and see what they’ve been drawing!
  • Here is a database of several printable accessories and clothes for your robot!




Play Communs in the press


  • Make 

    “Watch the video below to see them in action, or if you happen to be in Italy this weekend you’ll find them at the first Make faire, the European Edition in Roma…” 

    Nick Noraml, 10/04/2013
  • 90+10 "Play Communs es un ejéricito de 31 coloridos robots diseñados por niños, ydesarrallados por Ultra Ordinaire,un grupo di diseño con sede en Toulouse… " 90+10@90mas10, 16.04.2013
  • Design context "Play communs: la fantasia programma l’elettronica” Antonella Mazzola, 27/09/2013
  • Le nouvel obs "Comment insuffler l’esprit maker aux enfants ? Nathalie Bruyère, 46 ans prof de design à l’Institut supérieur des Arts de Toulouse, a mis au point des petits robots en kit avec Pierre Duffau…"Nicole Pénicaut, 24 au 30 Juillet 2014.
  • Le parisien magazine "Il n’y a pas que les Lego pour satisfaire les élans d créativité des petits !... " Thomas Lestavel, vendredi 11 juillet 2014
  • Core 77 "Play Communs : The Robotic 21st Century Take on the Paper Doll” Erika Rae, 11 Jul 2014
  • MoCo "The Play Communs Robot Construction Kit combines toy robots and craft with its acrylic frame that can be "dressed" with paper clothes." Harry / July 2, 2014
  • Corriere della sera  Design : oltre il mobile c'è di più. "Fare architettura e design in una società della condivisione: «Siamo circondati da troppi oggetti, troppi brand, troppi design guru» dice Bruyère. «Il design deve recuperare il suo valore sociale e non deve più nascondere la sua complessità dietro una forma. " Manuela Mimosa Ravasio, 18 aprile 2014
  • Domus   "Invented by Ultra Ordinaire, with Nathalie Bruyère and Pierre Duffau, Play Communs is a toy that aims to bring young and old closer to electronics."  3 July 2014


Play Communs Story

Play communs is a toy that has been developed over one year by Ultra Ordinaire, a research team managed by Duffau&Associés.

Our aim was to “create objects that can be modified, fixed and adapted by the user“.

This work results from a collaboration with several innovative communities within the fields of sciences, engineering, design and creation concentrated upon the construction of a product that is at once sober, adaptable, modifiable and shareable.

The team consists of:

  • For the electronics: Snootlab French society created in 2010, official Arduino dealer, designing and developing electronics within an approach of Open hardware and Open source.
  • For coding: Theo de la Hogue and Pol Perez (From GMEA)
  • For creation: Nathalie Bruyère & Pierre Duffau (Duffau&associés) with assistance from Charlie Aubry, Irina Pentecouteau, Cécile Laporte.


The kit is already on sale at the arduino store & snootlab !

arduino store

snootlab store


What we need for further developement

We aim to collect funds to develop a community of makers that supports the values of sharing, enhancing, modifying, adapting and fixing. The web site Ultra-ordinaire.com is available where drawings can be shared.



Production timeline

1st series : Premium Kit for Christmas

NOVEMBER : Order and commencement of production of the kits.

DECEMBER : Reception, assembling and packing of the kits.

MID DECEMBER : Shipping kits for Christmas !

2nd series  

MAY : delivery of the kits !


Why we need your help

We have fully functional samples of Play Communs that are ready for production. Although we have big ambitions, we are a small company and only have the capacity to finance modest production runs.  Placing an order for multiple thousands of units is beyond our grasp. This is where you come in.  You can help us to increase the amount of product we can order from the factory as well as accelerate the speed with which we can get it into the homes of our customers.

others and see what they’ve been drawing!
Here is a database of
several printable accessories and clothes for your robot!





Play
Communs in the press





Make “Watch the video below to see them in action, or if you happen to be in
Italy this weekend you’ll find them at the first Make faire, the European
Edition in Roma…” 

Nick Noraml, 10/04/2013


90+10 "Play Communs es un ejéricito de 31 coloridos robots diseñados
por niños, ydesarrallados por Ultra Ordinaire,un grupo di diseño con sede en
Toulouse… " 90+10@90mas10,
16.04.2013


Design context "Play communs: la fantasia programma l’elettronica” Antonella
Mazzola, 27/09/2013


Le nouvel obs "Comment insuffler l’esprit maker aux
enfants ? Nathalie Bruyère, 46 ans prof de design à l’Institut supérieur
des Arts de Toulouse, a mis au point des petits robots en kit avec Pierre
Duffau…"Nicole
Pénicaut, 24 au 30 Juillet 2014.


Le parisien magazine "Il n’y a pas que les Lego pour
satisfaire les élans d créativité des petits !... " Thomas
Lestavel, vendredi 11 juillet 2014


Core 77 "Play Communs : The Robotic 21st Century Take on the Paper
Doll” Erika Rae, 11 Jul 2014

MoCo "The Play Communs Robot Construction Kit combines toy robots and craft with its acrylic frame that can be "dressed" with paper clothes." Harry / July 2, 2014

Corriere della sera  Design : oltre il mobile c'è di più. "Fare architettura e design in una società della condivisione: «Siamo circondati da troppi oggetti, troppi brand, troppi design guru» dice Bruyère. «Il design deve recuperare il suo valore sociale e non deve più nascondere la sua complessità dietro una forma. " Manuela Mimosa Ravasio, 18 aprile 2014


Domus   "Invented by Ultra Ordinaire, with Nathalie Bruyère and Pierre Duffau, Play Communs is a toy that aims to bring young and old closer to electronics."  3 July 2014




Play Communs Story

Play communs is a toy that has been developed over one year by Ultra
Ordinaire, a research team managed by Duffau&Associés.
Our aim was to “create objects that can be modified,
fixed and adapted by the user“.
This work results from a collaboration with several innovative
communities within the fields of sciences, engineering, design and creation concentrated upon
the construction of a product that is at once sober, adaptable, modifiable and shareable.
The team consists of:



For the electronics: Snootlab French society created in 2010, official
Arduino dealer, designing and developing electronics within an approach of Open
hardware and Open source.


For coding: Theo de la Hogue and Pol Perez (From GMEA)


For creation: Nathalie Bruyère & Pierre Duffau (Duffau&associés) with assistance from Charlie Aubry, Irina Pentecouteau, Cécile Laporte.



The kit is already on sale at the arduino store & snootlab !




arduino store



snootlab store

What we need for further developement

We
aim to collect funds to develop a community of makers that supports the values of sharing, enhancing, modifying, adapting and fixing. The web site
Ultra-ordinaire.com is available where drawings can be
shared.




Production timeline
1st series : Premium Kit for Christmas
NOVEMBER : Order and commencement of production of the kits.
DECEMBER : Reception, assembling and packing of the kits.
MID DECEMBER : Shipping kits for Christmas !
2nd series  
MAY : delivery of the kits !



Why we need your help
We have fully functional samples of
Play Communs that are ready for production. Although we have big ambitions, we are
a small company and only have the capacity to finance modest production
runs.  Placing an order for multiple
thousands of units is beyond our grasp. This is where you come in. 
You can help us to increase the amount of product we can order from the
factory as well as accelerate the speed with which we can get it into the homes
of our customers.

story:
Help heal the world and assist in deep emotional healing for yourself, brother, sister, lover, parent, or friend.  

 
The Sophia School of Living Arts, founded by Sonya Sophia Illig O.M., supports a global community of people who are learning EFT (Emotional Freedom Techniques also called “Tapping”) to quickly neutralize emotional and physical trauma. Sonya Sophia has been leading EFT for 9 years and practicing the healing arts for 25. She is a world-renowned master level EFT Practitioner and Trainer who has led EFT workshops at such events as The International Alchemy Conference, The Conscious Life Expo, Leaders Causing Leaders Conference, Burning Man and many other venues around the world.
 
Our goal is to teach hundreds of millions of people how to become naturally adept at healing themselves emotionally and simultaneously giving them powerful life skills to help the others around them recover and thrive!
 
Tapping rapidly dissolves emotional scars from such things such as PTSD (war trauma), sexual abuse, divorce, death of a loved one, financial devastation, accidents, surgeries, chronic illness and injuries. EFT can also be used to heal learning disorders, depression, self-esteem, anger, fears, phobias, and addictions of all kinds. We want the world to know how to use EFT and to be come artfully skilled in dealing with life’s issues!
 
The Sophia School of Living Arts bases its curriculum in empathy, love and self-reflection. We will train people though on-demand videos and live online classes how to use their own bodies and their own consciousness to fully release past experiences, thus creating more positive, harmonious and sustainable outcomes for all.
 
We see that healthy loving people create healthy loving children;
Heathy loving children create healthy loving parents;
And healthy loving parents create a heathy loving world that is safe and sane
For all children, animals and plants!
 
By healing past events and releasing dysfunctional family patterns from our collective ancestral lineages, we all become restored to the intelligent, loving, self-governing and emotionally balanced beings we were born to be!
 
We are sharing this knowledge through self-paced online learning and in-person study with Master EFT Practitioners. Utilizing this wisdom creates personal peace and activates a dynamic, living template of true transformation.
 
We are creating a profound capacity in people to shape and rectify their lives and this world!
 
We have seen people who use this training naturally become powerful activists and empowered community leaders. By supporting this campaign you will see families heal, new eco-business thrive, and communities around the world achieve optimal function and true peace.
 
We need $55,000 to launch this online school in February of 2013. Costs associated with this project include:
  • Management and Staffing
  • Equipment and Supplies
  • Web design, coding, maintaince, and hosting
  • Video creation, editing and distribution
  • Audio creation, editing and distribution
  • Online course management
  • Founding Costs
  • Legal Fees
  • Publicizing
For contributing financially you will you be a part of a HEALING WAVE that is really CHANGING LIVES in OUR WORLD. Along with our sincere gratitude, you may receive one of the following perks:
  • A  MP3 download of  one of Sonya's most popular titles:
    • Living Now
    • Activating Divine Purpose
    • Thriving Now
    • Tapping into Money & Prosperity
    • Love and Relationships
  • A limited-edition "Team Love" T-shirt
  • A 45-minute EFT video download featuring one of our EFT graduate assistants for beginning to heal:
    • Sexual Abuse
    • Chronic Illness
    • Issues Concerning Being Gay
    • Handling Depression
  • A gift certificate for a private 60-minute EFT Session with one our graduate assistants (either in-person or online depending on location)
  • A free pass to a one-day, in-person EFT event with Sonya Sophia (good for next 5 years)
  • A private 90-minute EFT session with Sonya Sophia (either in-person or online depending on location)
  • A free pass to a Weekend EFT Healing Intensive with Sonya Sophia (good for next 5 years)
  • A free access to The Sophia School of Living Arts 6-week live, online class led by Sonya Sophia for "Love and Relationships"
  • Full Access to our online school EFT video/media library for one year
  • Full Access to our online school EFT video/media library and all online classes for a one year
  • Full Access to our online school EFT video/media library and all online classes the duration of The Sophia School of Living Arts
 
Please give generously to make the The Sophia School of Living Arts a reality for this world.  If you can’t help fund this personally you can help by choosing to share it with the rest of the world by blogging, tweeting, posting it and telling everyone so we can make this project happen!
 

Please help make this school a reality for all the children coming in and for all the beautiful, brave people already here. Healing for humanity is possible and class about to begin!

 
In Loving Service,
Sonya Sophia O.M.

story:
• WHO I AM.

My Name is Tiffani and I am a mother of two. I have been serving the Lord for 4 short years and this will be my second missions trip since I received my calling. I believe fully in doing the work of God, and loving people the way Jesus Christ loves us. Jesus came to this world to serve and not to be served, so how much more should we His people serve others?! 

 

    • WHAT I/WE DO.

Every year I go with F.L.A.M.E. on these missions trips we have several different teams within our team, we have medical teams and dental teams that do check ups and cleanings and sometimes perform minor procedures, our construction teams help to build/re-build and make improvements on already exsisting churches, and new this year our childrens team will spend the week doing VBS with children in 3 different locations in Costa Rica!!  We also have nightly church services and I will be sharing my testimony of Gods great grace and love during a womens conference for the second time.

 

    • WHO IT IMPACTS, AND HOW.

The impact is amazing for those in Costa Rica who receive the blessings of the Lord. My first missions trip was in 2011 and I am still writing back and forth with one of the girls I met, and gave her first bible to when I was there(isayana- the girl in the last picture). We always bring large amounts of childrens clothes with us so we can offer them to families coming to the  medical and dental clinics, you would be surprised at the number of children we see Monday - Friday in the same worn out and dirty clothes, and the look on their beautiful faces when you give them a new pair of clothes to wear! Many of those we serve in the medical and dental clinics are receiving care for the first time in their lives, and if not the first time, they have only received care the last time we were in the area!

 

    • WHY I NEED HELP AND WHAT YOU CAN DO.

I understand that not everyone can give but please if you would pass the word along, let others know, get the word out for me please!! My original plan was to pay of the remaining balance with my tax returns but I like many others according to the IRS themselves, have been sent to the error department and it doesn't look like it will be coming through any time before the end of April and my trip is the first week of April!! But I know that God has a plan and purpose and I am supposed to be on this trip, and He will always make a way where there seems to be no way! Thanks so much for reading my story. Now go and share please. May God bless you for your willingness to give and share!

 

GOD IS GOOD!! Although my goal has been reached please feel free to continue to give and share, any and all funds received that are beyond my goal will go directly to the funding of FLAME and other costs that are involved in this trip, VBS materials ect.

story:
Kappa Delta Sorority at Texas Tech and Prevent Child Abuse America!

Every year Kappa Delta Sorority at Texas Tech Univeristy holds a 48 Hour See-Saw-A-Thon Fundraiser for The Lubbock South Plains Children's Advocacy Center (CAC) and Prevent Child Abuse America (PCAA)!  

The CAC provides children with a teddy bear and counseling to cope with their past abuse. Last year we contributed over $20,000 to them. Without this contribution they would not have been able to keep running the CAC. We always want to do our best and provide what we can for these children and in our local community! 

80% of your gracious donation will go towards the CAC while the other 20% will go towards PCAA! 

Other Ways YOU Can Make a Difference!

- Attend our See-Saw Event at the local Market Street on 50th and Indiana, any time from FEB 28- MAR 4th, and show your support!

- Share this page on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, E-Mail and all of your family and friends!

- Bring a teddy bear to a Kappa Delta to give to the CAC!

story:
Books in Action Campaign - Provide Girls a Path to Education

My name is Dawn Kane. After our book club read, "Behind the Beautiful Forevers," by Katherine Boo, we decided to take action to improve the plight of girls seeking to further their education in India.

A little money can go a long way for a girl in India. According to ODAM, an organization where I volunteered in Tamil Nadu India, as little as $15000 INR, or approximately $240 US can help a girl go to university. ODAM has three girls that have completed secondary studies, received high marks, and want to continue their education in university.

In addition, ODAM works with approximately 100 other children at the primary and secondary level. Monthly costs are $40,000, or nearly $700 US.  This does not sound like a lot of money, but for these children, it can be the difference between working in a factory or going to school in a safe environment.

What We Can Do

Our goal is to raise $2200 US. This will provide funds for the 3 girls to attend university, and will provide additional funds to cover two months of boarding school for the primary and secondary students.

The Impact

So, if you contribute $20 US, that will provide money to cover the expenses of one month of school for one girl to attend university. That $20 could make the difference between a life of unemployment versus a career as a teacher to a student like Chitradevi. (Shown in the video above)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to organize your own little fundraiser to contribute to this campaign, please consider:
  • Art Auctions
  • Bake Sales
  • 50/50 Raffles

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Who We Are

 

The Southeast Michigan Dyke March is a non-profit organization with the goal of promoting visibility of the area’s lesbian, transgender, bisexual and queer community. We are currently finalizing the Second Annual Southeast Michigan Dyke March and Rally for June 4, 2011, in Downtown Ferndale in celebration and promotion of visibility, equality, and vitality.

 

The Southeast Michigan Dyke March is based on a worldwide movement. We use the term Dyke March as a means of identifying with other dyke marches that came before us started by the Lesbian Avengers in 1993. Since their march in Washington D.C. with 20,000 participants, similar marches have been formed in cities like Boston, Chicago, Toronto, San Francisco, Denver, New York and now Detroit. (Source: About.com) It was intended to bring a sense of inclusion and promote visibility for the queer female community. Now many dyke marches, like ours, are inclusive of all queer groups across boundaries of sex, race, gender identity, religion, body type, economic class, sexuality, ethnicity, age, ability, and geographical origin.

                                

We Need People Like You

 

Each year the cost of running the march and rally increases, as well as our involvement in other programs. Being a completely volunteer run and community funded non-profit, we are looking for generous donors.

 

After June 4th we will be continuing our educational and social outreach events while acting as a fresh voice in the LGBTQA community. Our events are designed for all ages and all walks of life providing information, inspiration, education, representation and, of course, fun.

 

The Breakdown

                      

You are vital to making the Southeast Michigan Dyke March a success. 100% of all funds raised go directly to Southeast Michigan Dyke March costs. We hope to raise HALF of our budget through this online campaign!  The rest is being fundraised by our other year round events and other outreach.

                                     

This year our overall budget is approximately $4,500.

This includes the following:

 

Advertising and Printing $470

Handicap Restroom Rental $110

Banner Updated (orig. price $133.56) update approx $25

Sound / Stage / Rally Equipment: $190

Special Events Application fee: $25

Site Plan Review: $50

Park Rental Fee and Deposit: $250 (175+75)

One Day Insurance: $250

Vendor Permit: $50

Police: $1,327

Auxiliary Police Coordination Fee: $100

Merch/Decorations $1385

Food/Water $133

Website/Media: $135

Security Deposit for police waived by City of Ferndale

DPW Class 1 Barricades: provided by City of Ferndale

DPW Recycling Bins: provided by City of Ferndale

 

If you are unable to donate funds there are a number of other ways to support us. New volunteers are always welcome to assist before, during and after the event.  New opportunities are always developing, so please email us for more information!

 

Contact Us!

                             

semidykemarch.org

semidykemarch@gmail.com

facebook: southeast michigan dyke march

twitter @seMIdykemarch

story:
Hi friends,

My name is Darren.  I am leaving my job in the States to travel to Nepal to help open this childcare center.  My friend Dipendra is from Nepal.  He came to visit the non-profit where I work in Virginia City, Nevada called Community Chest Inc. through a State Department grant.  He learned about how we address social justice issues through our food bank, thrift store, mental health services, and early childhood education programs.  Based on what he learned from his visit here, Dipendra wants to open up a childcare centre in his village just outside of Kathmandu.  He has asked that I help him with this project.  I said yes and will be traveling to Nepal on October 15th to help make this happen.  

This center will develop the health of young children, employ women, and begin the process of sustainable development for this region.  Your contribution will make it possible for us to open this small facility.  Once open, the centre will host International volunteers who will form a donor base upon which the center will continue to operate.

We need $10,000 to open and operate the childcare center for one year.  This center will serve 40 children and fund 4 staff members.  This amount would also cover food, doctor's visits, dental check-ups, and materials and instruction for the children.  As you can tell, dollars can accomplish quite a bit more in a country like Nepal than they can in the States.  Any contribution that you can make gets us one step closer to making this a reality.

If we do not receive the entire $10,000 of funding for this project, we will at least have a good start on this project.  With the demonstrated support of this campaign, we will have a better chance at obtaining the remaining funds from foundations and other donors.

Not only will this project prepare Nepalese youngsters for success in school, but this childcare centre will also employ local women and allow parents and guardians to earn additional money to pay for basic necessities.  

If you are unable to contribute financially, that is OK.  There are certain times when I am not in a position to help with a cause that I would like to.  If you are unable to give dollars, please get the word out to others who may be able to help.  Everyone who reads this is an integral part of making this project happen.  Thank you!

story:
We are a group of students from the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee, studying American Sign Language Interpreting. With your help, we will be studying abroad in Siena, Italy this summer. 

This is the opportunity of a lifetime for us to experience a second Signed Language along with their culture and history. This, in turn, will benefit our American Sign Language abilities and immensely improve the quality of our future ASL Interpreting skills. 

Your contributions will support our mission in bridging the communication gap between the hearing world and Deaf worlds.

Your encouragement and financial support will provide the following:

  • 6 academic credits in Italian Sign Language, Italian Deaf Culture/History, and Spoken Italian
  • A place for us to rest our heads after hours of intellectual endeavors
  • Nutrients for our growing minds
  • Our voyage over the Atlantic Ocean
  • Our train trek through Tuscany to Siena 
  • An incredible journey to expand our horizons and understanding of Signed Languages.
We greatly appreciate your time and donations. Thank you so much!

Lets Get There! 

#SigningToSiena
