story:
I have spent 24 years of my life rocking audiences both behind the scenes; 

as a Creative Director (Regional Launch of LEVIs Mr Bombastic Ad Campaign), Show Director (The 2000 Singapore Grammy Awards - COMPASS), Music and Video Producer, Editor and Engineer (introduce 2000 Artiste of The Year), Flash Designer and Animator as well as rocking audiences as a Singer, Rapper, Comedian, Party Animal and Show Host performing in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand, Korea and Australia.

I was Branded The Entertainment Chameleon by The Straits Times. Life in a full page article. I won The Man on the Moon Comedy Contest! And I was even invited to do guest performances at Singapore's first comedy club; The Boom Boom Room in Bugis!

In 2003, my sister in the states completed her Phd and I started to her questions on what I should do if I wanted to create a lesson plan to teach kids. At that time, I didn't even know what I wanted to teach. But after a while I became "possessed", I submerged myself in the understanding of education, methods to crack creativity and the use of entertainment for education. 

Since then I have spent the last 12 years studying; 32 modules in flash design and animation, studying film making from Dove Simens, I took a certificate in public speaking (scoring 99% for 2 papers and 100% for 5 papers - more inspiration for me to persevere), another certificate in introduction to the learning process for teachers and trainers plus using lyrics for language training, and the icing was a distinction diploma in drama in education (21st Century Teaching Skills), and all these was happening whilst I was conducting an R&D in holistic education.

In 2012, my research papers were submitted to the Ministry of Education, Singapore and surprisingly I managed to get a "Registered School" and "Registered Teacher" status to teach Imagine Inventions! I sold my house and invested everything in my current centre, I am struggling but I am still rocking!

My program here reminds me of Harvard University's Multiple Intelligence programs and it's truly coincidental because I did not know about these 2 programs when I studied multiple intelligence; Project Zero and Project Spectrum, sounds like from zero to hero! 

My mini school is in a low income neighbourhood (though it's quite unheard of in Singapore but do bear in mind there are quite a number of homeless people here as well - which includes me cuz I sold my house). And many of my students are doing badly in school and socially but as I dug deeper into sensory disorders and learning disabilities, I realised that many of my students are suffering from Dyslexia, ADHD and other sensory disorders. 

Traditional school just does not work for them and my methods, slowly but surely are beginning to take shape thus I want to continue my research and expand my programs to meet the wider community.

The funds will be used to purchase more IT equipment, softwares, games; digital and hands on, tools for Dyslexia and ADHD. I can email you the exact details including receipts. Plus these softwares and tools can be used to do programs out of my centre. 

I am working with other agencies to create learning stations or what I or my students prefer to call "Party Stations". After school, every day kids will have plenty of fun activities to do to keep them off the streets and away from problems. Plus my centre will be the carrot, kids who participate in the programs will get "free game play" in my centre that I will transform to become a cyber cafe. All the kids here love cyber games and a funky environment where there is music and disco lights. These concept has managed to attract quite a number of students to my centre but I do not have enough IT equipment. The good news is that I can get my IT purchases reimbursed but I have to pay first and then get 60% back in 3 months. With the 60% back that means I can spend on other items that are not claimable like outdoor inflatable playground, glow in the dark soccer equipments and other fun stuff for kids to do after school instead of hanging around, doing nothing and getting into problems.

Some of my positive projections include being a social enterprise for 3 years to finish my research and then going not for profit to take this concept to other countries with similar problems. A friend of mine has a really cool set up in Bali here's the link and by the way they are doing crowd funding as well - Deliciouslifecampus.com and I recalled my days in Bali (though I could barely walk most of the time but I could jam the dance crowd in Gado Gado and Double Six with my mike. Felt like I was MC Amos with a jug of bourbon but with a slice of pizza somewhere near the DJs console), there are plenty of street kids in Bali and I speak Indonesian thus this would be an awesome place for me and my daughter to head to after my research is done or maybe even the place to go to if this funding does not happen. Nevertheless, my work continues because I have found not just awesome educational tools but many hidden methods on how disengaged kids can be motivated to learn.

But anyway, this funding is only for IT equipment, softwares and lah dee da so if you have any friends who are interested in helping us with the funding or maybe even friends who are interested in coming together to form a social enterprise or even a non profit then do give me a call or email. I think this concept can be dynamic anywhere and will work for disengaged as well as achievers plus let's not forget behind the "Party Stations" lies Imagine Inventions; a proprietary 9 main frame education system that has a wealth of benefits!

story:
Dear friends, 

On June 23rd, I will be taking the flight from Dubai to Beirut, Lebanon where I’ll spend two weeks volunteering for Jusoor Refugee Education Program, an educational program for Syrian refugee children in Lebanon. 

There are approximately 1000 children in 3 new learning centers that were built recently by Jusoor volunteers. While in Lebanon, I’ll spend my time working with all age groups – volunteering to help run the operations of the program and working closely with the kids.

I’m financing this trip; I’ve already booked my ticket and stay. However, I’m reaching out to you today with the goal of raising funds so I can take packed suitcases full of goodies for the kids – that include stationary supplies, books, DVDs, school bags, etc.. whatever fits and of course chocolate! Imagine the smile on their faces when I give them toys, coloring books, movies and so much more!

Alone I can’t change their lives; but if I can make these children smile, learn something new and leave them hopeful for a better future, I’ll consider this trip a great success. 

Help me make this trip impactful and meaningful by donating to my campaign and spreading the word! It will only be running for 10 days only thus till June 13th!

Warm and thankful hugs, 
Nina


For more information about the summer program please check: http://www.jusoor-sy.org/membership/summer-program/

For more information about the Syrian refugee crisis please check: http://www.unhcr.org.uk/news-and-views/news-list/news-detail/article/10-shocking-facts-on-the-syrian-refugee-crisis-in-lebanon.html

story:
The Summary

We are your 2013 Vic Slam Team - a collection of lovely individuals coming together as a whole to represent Victoria's spoken word community on the national stage at the 10th annual Canadian Festival of Spoken Word/Festival canadien de spoken word - happening this year in Montreal, November 4th-9th.  We're very excited with the words we have to bring, and the ones we plan to craft together.  We hope to build off the momentum charge of last year's team and make Victoria's biggest impact yet in the national spoken word community.


This is an exciting and challenging endeavor for all of us.  Not just in terms of the competition, which puts us up against nearly 100 of the hottest poets in Canada, but also in stealing away from our day-to-day lives in Victoria and the work and school commitments that comes with.  And so we turn to you.

The Pitch

As you probably already know, it's a pretty pricey endeavor to travel and accommodate across Canada for a week.  Especially as a group of six!  This is where we reach out to you for a boost.  Thanks to the amazing audiences who came out for Vic Slam Semis and Finals we have ourselves a nice little nest egg to kickstart our travel costs.  Coupled with some exciting upcoming shows, we should have ourselves most of the way to our estimate budget of $6,000 for the teams total travel/accommodation costs.  Here we ask you to help us take it to the brink.  If we raise $2000 here on the interwebs, we should have the rock solid finances in place to make sure we can represent Victoria to the fullest without incurring debt in the process.

If this campaign goes really crazy and we exceed our funding goals as they're currently laid out, we will make use of extra monies to make sure we're sharing healthy meals together throughout our adventure.  If we have an excess of extra funds leftover after eating we will pay forward any extra into a nest egg for next year's team!

In exchange for your directly helping us travel, sleep and eat we would like to give you things.  We have many strange and exciting things we can offer for your efforts. Beginning with our eternal gratitude - which has no price point!  We also want to offer up fun opportunities like your own poems, or a show in your home, or the chance to have Shayne and Johnny come and make you dinner.  A chance for us to do more of the things we love in exchange for your help getting us to Montreal!

The Impact

You are directly helping us get to Montreal to represent Victoria to the best of our abilities.  We can't emphasize this enough.  With all of us taking a week off of work and/or school, the support of the community in getting us across the country to represent us as a whole means so much to us, and greatly helps ease the impact on the rest-of-our-lives during this excursion.

Your contributions can also greatly add to our direct success in the competition, as each one allows us to spend more time working on new and existing pieces and less time figuring out financial logistics.  This allowance for more writing and workshopping further focuses our ability to bring our strongest performances possible in the tournament, and hopefully bring the trophies home.

If this fundraising effort is a raging success then we are all helping further the Victoria spoken word community by carrying forward a surplus of funds toward sending further poets to national events to represent Victoria and keep our scene vibrant and growing both locally and nationally.  We have a lot to offer and the rest of the country is catching on quickly.  Your contributions all help us nurture and build upon that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you broke?  A poet?  Both?  You can still support us by helping spread the word if you're unable to contribute monetarily.  Every tweet, tumble, stumble and share helps spread the word to help us spread our words, and this is all about sharing and community.  So every bit of support in any and every way is appreciated deeply and dearly, and helps to nurture and further build our community.

Thanks for being.

story:
Short Summary

We are raising funds for Lanier Black girls middle school softball team to buy updated safety equipment like helmets and catching gear for the girls. Our middle school softball teams do not recieve funding for this type of equipment from the public school system. The girls are already hard at work on the field and with other fundraising. All help in any amount is appreciated and all funds will go towards this goal! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to pay for helmets, Catchers gear, sliding pants and basic safety equipment for the team. 

For any amount you will get a personal thank you from the coaches in person or Email and Facebook. 

The Impact

By donating you are helping ensure that our girls are playing with the most up to date safety equipment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just by spreading the word via social media and liking our link on Facebook!

story:
Today, new college graduates are forced to choose between profit and purpose, thereby diverting top talent from helping to address society’s greatest challenges. 

That's why Service Year is paving an innovative new career path and building a movement of socially engaged citizens who refuse to give back. We Give First.


What is Service Year?

Service Year, the Career Accelerator, is the first corporate sponsored national service organization.

We empower top college graduates to launch a career AND make an immediate social impact by deferring their start date at leading corporations for one transformative year of service at high-impact nonprofits.

Their contribution strengthens the nonprofit sector and sets them on a path to become lifelong, socially-engaged business leaders.

More information:

  • Service Year was founded by Matt Ronen in 2014 with a simple dream: Imagine a world where the most talented emerging professionals tackle society's toughest challenges the first year of their career and every year thereafter. 
  • You can learn more about Matt's story and Service Year on our website.
  • Service Year is teaming up with #GivingTuesday to launch its first ever crowdfunding campaign.
  • A small contribution of $5, $18, $36 can make a big difference for Service Year and the lives of our beneficiaries.

We need to raise $500 to activate our 1st nonprofit organization

  • With our upcoming launch in Summer of 2015, we need to activate 18 high-performing nonprofit organizations.
  • Your contribution will help us activate our first nonprofit.
  • Once a nonprofit is active in our network, we are able to provide them with human resources valued at $75,000+
  • Your gift will be met with a personalized postcard sent from our Founder and a permanent "Thank You!" on our website.

Other ways you can help

Even if you can’t contribute, or if you can contribute, but still want to do more:

  • Get the word out by emailing friends, posting on Facebook, and retweeting.
  • Sign up for the Service Year newsletter on our homepage: www.serviceyear.org
  • Like our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/ServiceYear
  • Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/ServiceYearUS 

Thanks for checking us out!

     nonprofit. 
Once a nonprofit is active in our network, we are able
     to provide them with human resources valued at $75,000+

Your gift will be met with a personalized postcard sent
     from our Founder and a permanent "Thank You!" on our website.

Other ways you can help
Even if you can’t
contribute, or if you can contribute, but still want to do more:

Get the word out by emailing friends, posting on
     Facebook, and retweeting.
Sign up for the Service Year newsletter on our homepage: www.serviceyear.org

Like our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/ServiceYear

Follow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/ServiceYearUS 

Thanks for checking us out!

story:
Jack and the Beanstalk a Mathematical Adventure

Hi, my name is Jack. I know you have all heard of me before, I'm the guy who climbs an enormous beanstalk to retrieve the princess' amulet. But today I would like to tell you the real story of HOW I was actually able to accomplish such a feat.

My adventure all starts with a simple math question. I know what you're thinking - how does math have anything to do with my epic adventure? Let me confess to you my secret to confronting and out-smarting a giant; the secret is MATH. I used math to initially buy the beans, I used math to help sort through the giant's treasure of all sorts of geometric shapes to help me find the amulet, and I used math for just about every major obstacle on my journey.

Join me on my epic math adventure where you can help me avoid being boiled for breakfast or  figure out if I will have enough time to make it down the beanstalk before the giant catches me.

 

 

 

Do you want to help Jack solve his GIANT problems? Then this is your chance! For a limited time (Pre-Launch of app) receive the entire PDF book of "Jack and the Beanstalk a Mathematical Adventure" for FREE!!!

You will also receive updates & progress of the development of the App and you will be the first to know exactly when Jack will launch his epic mathematical adventure.

 

 

Hi. My name is Justin Holladay and I'm a Math Teacher and now iOS Game designer, I have developed an extensive background in the education realm. My passion for helping students reinforce essential math skills led me in attaining a B.Ed. and B.A.S. in Mathematics/Science. As an iOS game designer, I'm pursuing my passion of supporting teachers in effective teaching and integration of math games into their daily lessons. 

 

I love developing and designing new math games that can be utilized in the classroom and then "played" (practised but kids think they're playing) at home.

 

In November, 2012, I released my first math game on the App Store, since then I have released three more math apps

 

More info: http://www.mathfilefoldergames.com/my-math-apps/

 

PERSONAL NOTE:

I'm a worried parent of 5 young kids and was a frustrated middle school math teacher wanting to change this system. Students nowadays hate math (and score poorly too). My smart 8 year old son in grade 3 told me the other day that he hates math class. This shocked me! I'm a math teacher and I love math and my own son is learning at school to dread it.

 

I believe students need to spend more time "doing" math and less time drilling math. They need to be practicing, thinking, and applying mathematics every day BUT worksheets, tests, boring homework (please do questions 1-56) and any drill and kill type methods are hindering our children from mastering math!

 

I’ve realized that as a parent and math teacher I need to be able to raise children that also love math. What I want to do is also branch out from creating middle school apps, that my children are too young to use, to create interactive math games/adventures that my kids can use and play and learn to love math now!

 

My next project is going to be a Mathematical storybook adventure. You know all those storybook apps out there that your kids "listen" I mean “read” then tap everywhere on the screen with no real reason. With my math adventure the students will be read a story (maybe they’ll read it themselves too) and then be required to help the character to solve a math problem or activity.

 

I NEED YOUR HELP

 

I need to raise $5,000 to cover the cost of development of my mathematical storybook app or development will be SLOWED, i'll never stop, but will have to bootstrap slowly. All artwork and voice work are already complete.

So I'm turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, I'm offering ALL my apps FREE to you and your school or school district. Your contribution will help me to continue developing and focusing my time on creating and developing my math apps, and further, it will help our kids learn to love math!! . Thanks!

 

Join me on my journey to change our children's math classroom.

How can you help? There are two ways.

1. You can make a financial donation. The good news is that our economic model makes our expenses very low, and a little bit of money goes a long way. A donation of $50 could make all the difference. In fact, if 100 people give $50 each, we will reach our fundraising goal for one of our apps.

 

2. You can help spread the word. If this isnt the right time for you to give money, you can still support MathFileFolderGames.com by telling your friends about this campaign. Just emailing this campaign to 10 friends, re-posting on your Facebook page, pinning it to Pinterest, or Tweeting about it could make a significant difference.

We really appreciate your support and are so excited to see what we can do together to revolutionizing our children's math classroom.

 

STRETCH GOALS:

Mathematical Storybook Adventure Series

$20,000 - 2nd book in series

$30,000 - 3rd book in math series

$100,000 - finish series and start making android version

$105,000 - Make Android version

$200,000 - Make Android version concurrently with each book.
